Innovate is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you have a disability and require reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or cannot access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, please contact us at careers@innovateteam.com.

title: Roving M&E Specialist
description:
Location: North Wilkesboro, NC, United States  

Job ID: 14955  

Date Posted: Feb 9, 2024


### **Job Description**


**Get Involved!**


Are you a monitoring and evaluation professional looking for an opportunity to work with humanitarian aid worldwide? We are looking for a **Roving Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist** to join our team in **North Wilkesboro, NC**! This position will work as the liaison with our International Projects teams help create, implement, and maintain Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) systems that support the departments goals and purpose. This position also provides support to the Program Management team and international field offices on a as needed basis. Come be a part of what the Lord is doing here at Samaritan's Purse! **A day in the life of a Roving Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Specialist:**  

 At Samaritan's Purse, the Gospel really is the center of all we do! We start each day with a time of devotions and spend time praying for each other, our staff and volunteers who serve around the globe.  

In the role of **Roving Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Specialist**, you will have the opportunity to:  

* Maintain your personal relationship with Jesus Christ and be an effective witness for Him
* Support the creation of data collection tools for both paper-based and mobile data methods by response category and sector
* Create standard M&E operating procedures for Disaster Assistance Response Team (DART)
* Deploy with DART to assist with needs assessments, establish M&E systems, and assist with grantor proposal development
* Support international field offices through field visits or remotely by establishing M&E systems, designing and implementing evaluations and assessments, advising offices on data collection methods and statistical analysis, and assisting with proposal development
* Revise and standardize M&E curriculum for the training and mentoring of M&E staff
* All other duties as assigned

 **NOTE:** Position is based in our North Wilkesboro, NC office. We are unable to support remote based work at this time.
Learn more about serving with Samaritans Purse. **Qualifications & Experience:*** Minimum of a Bachelors degree (Masters degree preferred) and minimum of five (5) years related experience and/or training in monitoring and evaluation methodologies; or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Experience with theoretical and practical background in research and knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methodologies and techniques
* Thorough knowledge of M&E best practices and computer applications, including proficiency in SPSS or other similar statistical analysis software, Tableau, Excel VBA, and basic coding for Python, Java, SQL, iForm, ERP systems such as Serenic Navigator, GIS systems such as ArcGIS, MS Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook
* Ability to work in an international and multicultural environment. At least two (2) years experience living or working in a developing country preferred
* Ability to frequently travel internationally
* 12 credit hours of college-level Biblical Studies (required); if not already completed, opportunity to meet and complete requirement is available upon hire.

 **Job Location:** North Wilkesboro, NC  

**Type:** Full-Time  

**Travel Expectations:** Estimated 120 days/annually; required travel documents and vaccinations for entry into foreign countries will be necessary **Benefits:**  

* On-site Medical Clinic (staff and dependents)
* Medical, prescription, dental & vision insurance
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Long-term and Short-term disability insurance
* Paid Family Medical Leave
* Term Life Insurance
* 401(k) retirement savings plan
* 10 paid holidays
* 12 vacation/personal days
* 10 sick days

 **Samaritan's Purse Mission Statement:**
Samaritan's Purse is a nondenominational evangelical Christian organization providing spiritual and physical aid to hurting people around the world. Since 1970, Samaritan's Purse has helped meet needs of people who are victims of war, poverty, natural disasters, disease, and famine with the purpose of sharing God's love through His Son, Jesus Christ. The organization serves the Church worldwide to promote the Gospel of the Lord Jesus Christ. **Samaritan's Purse Statement of Faith:*** We believe the Bible to be the inspired, the only infallible, authoritative Word of God. (1 Thessalonians 2:13; 2 Timothy 3:15-17)
* We believe that there is one God, eternally existent in three persons: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit. (Matthew 28:19; John 10:30; Ephesians 4:4-6)
* We believe in the deity of the Lord Jesus Christ, in His virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His vicarious and atoning death through His shed blood on the cross, in His bodily resurrection, in His ascension to the right hand of the Father, and in His personal return in power and glory. (Matthew 1:23; John 1:1-4 and 1:29; Acts 1:11 and 2:22-24; Romans 8:34; 1 Corinthians 15:3-4; 2 Corinthians 5:21; Philippians 2:5-11; Hebrews 1:1-4 and 4:15)
* We believe that all men everywhere are lost and face the judgment of God, that Jesus Christ is the only way of salvation, and that for the salvation of lost and sinful man, repentance of sin and faith in Jesus Christ results in regeneration by the Holy Spirit. (Luke 24:46-47; John 14:6; Acts 4:12; Romans 3:23; 2 Corinthians 5:10-11; Ephesians 1:7 and 2:8-9; Titus 3:4-7)
* We believe in the present ministry of the Holy Spirit, whose indwelling enables the Christian to live a godly life. (John 3:5-8; Acts 1:8 and 4:31; Romans 8:9; 1 Corinthians 2:14; Galatians 5:16-18; Ephesians 6:12; Colossians 2:6-10)
* We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost; the saved unto the resurrection of eternal life and the lost unto the resurrection of damnation and eternal punishment. (1 Corinthians 15:51-57; Revelation 20:11-15)
* We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in the Lord Jesus Christ and that all true believers are members of His body, the church. (1 Corinthians 12:12, 27; Ephesians 1:22-23)
* We believe that the ministry of evangelism and discipleship is a responsibility of all followers of Jesus Christ. (Matthew 28:18-20; Acts 1:8; Romans 10:9-15; 1 Peter 3:15)
* We believe Gods plan for human sexuality is to be expressed only within the context of marriage, that God created man and woman as unique biological persons made to complete each other. God instituted monogamous marriage between male and female as the foundation of the family and the basic structure of human society. For this reason, we believe that marriage is exclusively the union of one genetic male and one genetic female. (Genesis 2:24; Matthew 19:5-6; Mark 10:6-9; Romans 1:26-27; 1 Corinthians 6:9)
* We believe that we must dedicate ourselves to prayer, to the service of our Lord, to His authority over our lives, and to the ministry of evangelism. (Matthew 9:35-38; 22:37-39, and 28:18-20; Acts 1:8; Romans 10:9-15 and 12:20-21; Galatians 6:10; Colossians 2:6-10; 1 Peter 3:15)
* We believe that human life is sacred from conception to its natural end; and that we must have concern for the physical and spiritual needs of our fellowmen. (Psalm 139:13; Isaiah 49:1; Jeremiah 1:5; Matthew 22:37-39; Romans 12:20-21; Galatians 6:10)

title: Customer Success Manager (GIS)
description:
Neara is a high-growth, venture-backed Series B, tech company headquartered in Sydney, Australia. We work with 75% of the utilities in Australia and New Zealand and are growing rapidly across the US and Europe. Our mission is to revolutionize the utilities industry by helping them future-proof their infrastructure and navigate the challenges of the clean energy transition. Our 3D digital network model enables utilities to simulate various scenarios and make informed decisions to protect their assets and communities.



We are excited to hire our next Customer Success Manager here at Neara. Customer Success Managers are the ones ensuring that clients do not just buy our company's software but foster lasting relationships with customers, ensuring their success over time.To accomplish this, they talk with clients, understand their processes and goals, define and complete objectives, and provide training sessions.



Our training is fast-paced, designed to bring you up to speed on our software along with our related processes, you will be joining our customer success team to work directly with new customers. This position will require a large amount of learning on behalf of the candidate to be proficient with the industry, our products and the value it offers. We are looking for individuals who can quickly learn the domain knowledge and become experts in the technical aspects.


**Some of the things you will contribute to:**


* Meet with clients at the completion of the sales cycle to turn opportunities into implementation projects
* Lead a comprehensive training program with a focus on practical use cases tailored to client needs and defined implementation stages.
* Engage in 1-1 sessions, setting up meetings, and onboarding diverse groups to align with client lifecycle management.
* Utilize MixPanel metrics and strategic internal meetings to inform decision making and ensure alignment with sales.
* Proactively monitor customer usage, provide value-added insights and conduct pre-calls before client meetings to drive continuous improvement.
* Manage customer engagement and outreach including highlighting company events, marketing campaigns, and communicating product and development roadmaps.
* Effectively convey new features and overarching plans through various channels to ensure client understanding and satisfaction.
* Perform configuration or customization required by the project scope
* Test and provide final QA/QC of project deliverables before a client is ready to go live
* Report on project status to leadership
* Python scripting or equivalent programming would be a huge bonus for this role - but not essential


**Some attributes we highly regard:**


* Electric utility industry and / or GIS/CAD experience
* Clear communication and collaboration with the broader Neara team
* Self-motivated, solutions-driven, detail-oriented, and organized
* Experience troubleshooting and resolving hardware and software issues
* Proficient in cloud-based applications
* Make product enhancement requests based on current, and future software capabilities
* Experience with programming, PLS CADD and / or LIDAR highly advantageous


 **Some of the benefits we have an offer:**


* Competitive salary + ESOP
* Health, vision, dental and 401K
* Excellent PTO Offering
* Flexible hours and working arrangements
* The real benefit is working on a genuinely complex, innovative and industry leading product making a genuine difference in the world around us.


To apply, please use the online application link below. Neara values diversity, belonging and equal employment opportunities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. We will endeavour to give you an update on your application within 7-10 working days.


**Please note, you will require current and unrestricted working rights to be considered for the role. Unfortunately we are not in a position to offer visa sponsorship at this time.**

  

*\\*\\* No agencies or third party service providers please \\*\\**

  


Questions? Email talent@neara.com.

title: Wetland Scientist/Permitting Specialist
description:
**DESCRIPTION:**


This opportunity is for a flexible and self-motivated individual that is willing to learn and grow as part of a team while providing wetland and permitting expertise to projects within the Sediment and Risk Assessment (SRA) and Remediation (REM) service lines at EHS Support. You will be joining a high-performance team of ecologists, scientists, risk assessors, and engineers that is focused on providing high-quality technical and strategic solutions to a variety of clients. Your primary responsibilities will include developing EHS Support’s wetland and waterways capabilities, including, but not limited to, wetland assessment, delineation, valuation, permitting, and restoration services. You will also be responsible for development and delivery of technical reports or other regulatory submittals to report findings.


The selected candidate will lead federal, state, and local regulatory permitting processes to obtain authorization for construction and environmental remediation activities that may impact wetlands, waterways, or other regulated natural resources. Field responsibilities will include leading the assessment and delineation of wetlands, waterways, or other regulated natural resources within the project area. Permitting responsibilities will include identification of coordination with regulatory agencies through permit application approval. You may also provide technical support to projects focused on ecological risk assessment, sediment assessment and remediation, biodiversity and ecological services, Natural Resource Damage Assessment (NRDA), and water quality compliance.


Typical technical responsibilities will include:


* Planning and leading field-based assessments of wetlands, waterways, and other regulated natural resources, including the delineation of regulated resources in accordance with U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) and state protocols (New Jersey and New York experience is preferred)
* Leading federal, state, and local regulatory permitting processes for construction and environmental remediation activities
* Developing aquatic and terrestrial habitat restoration design plans
* Providing assessments of wetland functions and values
* Supporting NRDA


Typical managerial responsibilities will include:


* Developing and implementing project execution plans
* Participating in project strategy discussions with technical team members and clients
* Working with internal resources to identify appropriate staffing and skillsets and define roles and responsibilities of project team members
* Establishing timelines and maintaining regular communications with the project team to ensure timely deliverables
* Reviewing project reports and taking corrective measures to ensure quality work products or address challenges
* Managing financial project performance and maintaining work within scope and budget
* Understanding all project aspects, including objectives, scope of work, technical requirements, regulatory framework, and contract compliance and communicating these items to project team members
* Reviewing project invoices and adhering to internal quality control procedures
* Mentoring and upskilling of junior staff
* Maintaining communications with clients or internal client managers on progress via written and verbal communications


Experience in the following focus areas is preferred:


* Freshwater and coastal wetland delineation and permitting in accordance with federal, state, and local regulations
* Plant and soils identification
* Aquatic and terrestrial habitat restoration design
* Wetland functions and values assessment
* National Environmental Policy Act documentation
* NRDA
* State and federal special status species
* Ecological risk assessment
* Sediment and surface water quality assessment
* Biological community surveys

**POSITION REQUIREMENTS:**


Traits desired for success in our team:


* Critical thinking and analytical skills
* Attention to detail in terms of technical deliverables, client communications, and reports
* Willingness to learn and gain technical expertise by working on multiple projects and with experts in technical area of practice
* Effective technical writing and oral presentation skills
* Ability to develop and maintain positive relationships with clients and co-workers
* Effective mentor and delegator
* Ability to think strategically and conceptually, as well as translate strategy into practical and tactical plans
* Ability to work independently and seek guidance at key points in the project
* Ability to travel to project sites, as needed, to complete field surveys in varying conditions
* Excellent planning and organizational skills with strong problem-solving abilities
* Strong communication skills and willingness to communicate proactively, efficiently, and directly with team members


Skills required for success in this role include:


B.S. or M.S. degree in environmental science, biology, ecology, natural resources, or a closely related field of study • 5 to 10 years of freshwater and coastal wetland experience in environmental consulting or similar work experience • Ability to design and implement field-based wetland assessments and restoration plans • Experience preparing state and federal wetland permit applications • An understanding of environmental regulations and guidance under state and federal programs (e.g., RCRA, CERCLA) • Familiarity with ESRI GIS, AutoCAD and MS applications.


**LOCATION:** Anywhere in U.S. (home office-based position); though, greater Philadelphia region is preferred.


EHS Support is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, and/or disability status.

title: GIS Engineer-GIS/ArcGIS Experience Required
description:
(Remote)

  



NexGen is currently seeking a **GIS Engineer** who would develop and modify scalable architecture to support applications and assist in the design and management of an organization's GIS systems, applications, policies, and strategy. This position would incorporate security management and privacy requirements into GIS service offerings. This individual will be required to work closely with members of the NexGen and client teams, including but not limited to, domain experts and developers.

  


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:**


* Ensure enterprise GIS systems are supported by guaranteeing the accuracy and effectiveness of the system, meeting business and customer requirements, monitoring the performance of systems, verifying, and reviewing system related documents/reports, including installation to meet requirements of all specified task as identified below.
* Design, implement and maintain enterprise GIS systems:
* Incorporate a variety of information streams with existing GIS data and IT infrastructure.
* Plan and design enterprise GIS systems infrastructure in an on-premises and cloud environment using knowledge of ArcGIS from an IT context (such as backup, installation, data restore, storage, security, networking, web services, virtualization, cloud computing, validation).
* Monitor the performance of systems and recommend improvements to maximize efficiency and functionality.
* Verify and review system related documents/reports, including installation procedures.
* Maintain geospatial databases, ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and efficiency. Create and manage data schemas, relationships, and metadata.
* Troubleshoot issues related to Esri application deployment and system architecture for on-premises and cloud platforms.
* GIS engineering coordination. Tasks may include:
* Work collaboratively with a variety of vendors’ technical support teams and IT, data center, and related staff.
* Communicate with end users reporting issues related to ArcGIS Enterprise/open source and related systems.
* Develop custom GIS tools to automate workflows, enhance GIS functionality, and optimize data processing.
* Design controls and processes that utilize available audit tools.
* Maintain up-to-date and extensive knowledge of ESRI products and technology.
* Other duties may be assigned.

  


**Technical Skills:**


* Experience with the following systems/protocols/scripting languages to plan and design the GIS systems infrastructure as well as implement various hardware and software to meet requirements:
* ESRI desktop, server, web, and mobile mapping technologies, including ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Pro, Collector for ArcGIS, Story Maps, Field Maps, and Survey 123.
* Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL and Enterprise Geodatabases.
* Front-end, back-end or automation programming and scripting experience with: Python, JavaScript, Swift, Kotlin, HTML5 PowerShell, Ansible, and Structured Query Language (SQL).
* Windows operating system based cloud environments, and basic network administration.
* Familiar with Agile methodologies.

  


**Desired Skills:**


* Work experience within the federal government.
* Knowledge of commonly applied standards including the Federal Geographic Data Committee (FGDC).

  


**Additional Requirements:**


* The candidate should also possess strong oral and written communication skills, problem-solving skills and should be a team player.
* The successful candidate will also be able to pass background screening prior to employment.
* US citizenship, or legal permanent residence, or US work authorization with minimum three years of continuous US presence is required due to federal contract requirements.

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, or related discipline with two to three years of related experience.

  



***NexGen Technologies, Inc., is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.***

  



Compensation: $75,000-102,000 per year (Dependent on Experience)

title: Project Specialist II/III/IV- Midstream (Remote)
description:
**Location:** Pittsburgh, PA
**Job Category:** Permitting & Civil
**Sub-Department:** SURFACEUSE
**Job ID:** 2168
**EQT is the United States largest producer of natural gas with a goal to reach Net Zero by or before 2025 (among the fastest in the industry).**


**From the office to the field, the #EQTeam is fueling the future. Power your potential with us.**



At EQT, we are making strides toward becoming the best producer by creating long-term value for all stakeholders, including employees, landowners, communities, industry partners and investors. Our vision is to evolve EQT into a modern, connected, digitally enabled organization.


With an incredibly collaborative culture and a determined, progressive workplace, EQT was both named a National Top Workplace, as well as one of Pittsburgh’s Best Places to Work!


**Join our Qrew!**


**The Project Specialist II/III/IV- Midstream responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Identify and locate surface and gas estate ownership, analyze, interpret, prepare, negotiate and acquire Midstream Agreements, Right of Ways and other surface related contracts.
* Ability to prepare, analyze and read landman title, assemble and analyze oil and gas data and maps, identify potential pad sites and right of way locations and conduct pre-construction investigation and planning activities.
* Management of our contractors to ensure surface projects are moving in a timely manner and meeting deadlines while staying on budget.
* Work closely with surveying, permitting and construction personnel, evaluate, negotiate, and settle damage claims.
* Work with attorneys and third-party companies as needed to complete projects on time and within budget.


**Required Experience and Skills:**


* Minimum 5-7 years in a similar role.
* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field, desired.
* Working knowledge of the oil and gas industry.
* Ability to problem solve and provide solutions.
* Must be self-motivated and organized with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and manage work time efficiently.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Proficient Microsoft Office skills including Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint as well as Adobe Acrobat, with the ability to learn additional software applications.
* Must have outstanding interpersonal skills and demonstrate tact and a professional demeanor in dealing with all levels of personnel.
* Strong drive to seek innovative ways to perform better, faster and more efficiently.


**Preferred Experience and Skills:**


* Experience with GIS, SmartSheet, Quorum, Salesforce, PowerBI is preferred, but not required.


Remote work is being considered for this role excluding the following states: Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Tennessee, Louisiana, New Jersey, and New York unless willing to relocate



Selected incumbent will be placed into the position that best suits their abilities and experience level.



EQT Corporation and its subsidiaries is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Disabilities/Veterans

title: GIS, Spatial and Data Analyst
description:
**MUST BE US CITIZEN AND CLEARABLE**



Do you want to perform work that is impactful to millions of Americans and has a broader global impact? Are you a service-minded team player who works towards creating solutions for the greater good?


**We Empower You to Serve!**



SRE delivers Organizational Transformation Services to the federal Government through Strategy, People, Leadership Development, Coaching, Facilitation, and Organizational Change Management. We underpin this with Project Management, business process improvement, and the use of technology as an enabler.



Our mission is to serve our country, our communities, and our employees. Our vision is to make a positive impact on the world by leaving it better off when we leave than when we came. We are seeking professional consultants who share in our mission of service, and our vision of leaving the world a better place, and are committed to our values of Integrity, Quality, and Performance.



After reviewing the position description, if you feel you are a fit for our organization and possess the required qualifications, we invite you to apply:



The GIS, Spatial, and Data Analyst will work with large, spatial, and GIS data sets to pull, analyze, report, visualize, and interpret data for technical and non-technical audiences.


**Duties may include, but are not limited to:**


* Perform use case analysis to identify data model requirements for climate data and visualization requests
* Use ArcGIS Pro, AGOL, ArcGIS Hub and ModelBuilder to develop applications, add data layers, and pull data
* Create and manage File Geodatabases
* Conduct data mining and quantitative and qualitative analysis to organize and present data in a format easily read by humans or machines
* Compile, manipulate, and refine spatial data from a variety of sources
* Analyze climate data to make projections and uncover patterns and trends
* Produce clear, complete, and accurate representations of geospatial data with minimal supervision
* Create scripts using Python, R, SQL, Arcade, VisQL, M, Power Query, DAX, and common geographic information system (GIS) programming languages
* Use statistical tools to provide diagnostic and predictive analytics
* Use Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, and other software to visualize, report, and integrate data and information based on audience
* Troubleshoot and fix coding errors and data-related issues

The advancement of solutions and proposed requirements which may include, wrangling, combining, and curating datasets * - utilizing best practice methods, tools, and functions for the greatest practicable data manipulation and visualization.
* Perform quality control checks of GIS data and non-spatial databases
* Quality Assurance (QA), Test and Evaluation (T&E), privacy requirements, cybersecurity, assessment of opportunities to incorporate Artificial Intelligence ("AI") and/or Machine Learning ("ML") into ODRR Test and Evaluation which may include, Predictive Analytics, Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLM), Generative AI, Training models, navigating access, compliance, privacy, and security concerns across all applicable platforms, data types, and use cases.
* Develop presentations, case studies, and documentation to help non-technical audiences understand how specific data/conclusions were derived, how to interpret data/conclusions, and how to use data
* Design and deliver responsive and/or interactive products.
* Create a wide range of geographic content including maps, scenes, apps, and layers for readily apparent insights that the client can rely upon to make strategically guided, timely, and effective decisions.
* Document data insights and outcomes to communicate information and methodology in an audience appropriate way
* Apply critical thinking skills and outstanding writing skills to communicate information in a readable format such as a dashboard, presentation, or white paper
* Provide guidance and support the use of Microsoft SharePoint, Teams, Power Automate, Power Apps, and related collaboration tools to streamline and automate tasks
* Must possess integrity and be service focused at all times
* Exhibit flexibility and resilience with both client organizations and SRE
* Must possess a drive for continual learning and professional growth
* Progressive experience in leading and providing technical direction of strategic business projects
* Demonstrated ability to provide guidance and direction for multiple projects or sub-tasks and in designing, implementing, and managing business programs
* Capability to manage multi-task projects of high complexity and must have demonstrated experience in managing all key project areas
* Provides primary interface with client personnel regarding strategic issues and on project specific issues
* Directs the completion of projects within estimated time frames and budget constraints
* Coordinates tasks, review work products for completeness and adherence to client requirements
* Experience includes demonstrated exceptional written and oral communication skills, including white papers and formal presentations
* Delivers presentations and leads client meetings
* Demonstrated ability to work independently


**Education and Experience:**


* Bachelor's degree and 5 years of experience in related field
* Demonstrated familiarity with Esri ArcGIS Pro and ArcGIS Online
* Demonstrated ability to use data tools and understand their application in spatial data
* Must have experience with: Python, R Studio, SQL, Arcade, VisQL, M, Power Query, DAX,
* Demonstrated experience and understanding of : AGOL, ArcGIS Hub, Tableau, MS Azure, MS 365, Power BI, SharePoint, Teams, Power Automate, and Power Apps.


**Skills:**


* Strong professional, interpersonal, and organizational skills
* Demonstrated cross-functional team collaboration skills in a rapidly changing, high intensity, mission-oriented work environment
* Demonstrated technical writing and presentation skills with the ability to adapt the product to the audience
* Analytical Skills: work with large amounts of data, including facts, figures, and number analysis; see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions
* Critical Thinking: look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings
* Attention to Detail: data is precise; the successful candidate will be vigilant in the analysis to come to correct conclusions
* A well-organized and self-directed individual who is a team player
* An intelligent and articulate individual who can relate to people at all levels of an organization and possesses excellent communication skills
* Enthusiastic team player with a strong drive to create a positive work environment
* Outstanding communication skills both in verbally and in writing
* SRE and Client mission oriented
* A processes and solutions oriented individual
* Must have experience and be an expert with Windows, MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, Gmail, Citrix ShareFile (or other online repositories), and online meeting platforms such as Google Meet and Zoom
* Must have experience with: Python, R Studio, Microsoft Power BI

title: Tribal Specialist
description:
Join our growing team of dedicated industry professionals driving the clean energy revolution through the launch of the US offshore wind industry. Vineyard Offshore is seeking dynamic and motivated individuals who are passionate about offshore wind and want to have an outsized impact in their career. We offer a challenging and exciting work environment that will provide broad exposure to the offshore wind industry and career advancement opportunities.

  

**A little bit about the projects:**


Vineyard Offshore brings industry-leading experience to the emerging US-based offshore wind market. Owned by Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners, half of the joint venture behind the Vineyard Wind 1 project, Vineyard Offshore is focused on developing projects that will deliver clean, renewable, and cost-effective offshore wind power around North America. In addition to Vineyard Wind 1, Vineyard Offshore currently owns two additional US lease areas that together can generate at least 3.5 gigawatts of offshore wind energy to power a minimum of two million homes along the mid-Atlantic and northeastern seaboards.

 **A little bit about the job:**

**Location:** New Bedford/Boston/New York

**Schedule:** 9 AM to 5 PM (Hybrid – 3 days in the office, 2 days… wherever!)

**Travel requirements**: This position may require travel as well as non-traditional hours.

**Employment Type:** Full-time, Salaried, Permanent

**Reports To:** Tribal Lead


The Tribal Specialist will be an integral member of the development team and primarily responsible for supporting the implementation of tribal communication and outreach programs for Vineyard Offshore’s lease areas. The successful candidate will be detail-oriented, eager to learn, and able to effectively prioritize. This position may require travel as well as non-traditional hours.

 **What you’ll do:**

* Contribute to Vineyard Offshores efforts to ensure effective communication and good working relations with Tribal Nations, including building and managing complex relationships among tribal members and representatives and keeping Tribal Nations proactively informed about project development efforts. Ensure tribal feedback is received in a timely manner and is shared with relevant project team.
* Support the implementation of tribal communication plans across lease areas and project phases, including site assessment, permitting, and construction and operations, and serve as a reliable point of contact for Tribal Nations and tribal representatives
* Coordinate and support the drafting of tribal communication plans, creation of presentations and other public materials, and contribute to website updates and social media posts
* Track and report on Tribal Nation engagement activities and Tribal Nation concerns, and ensure that company communications and activities adhere to a range of requirements and conditions, including federal regulations and other agency stipulations
* Manage budgets and coordinate contracting, invoicing, and sponsorship requests as well as plan and attend events and meetings as a Vineyard Offshore representative
* Assist in writing proposals, summarizing data, and documenting company policies for Tribal Nation engagement

 **What you’ll bring:**

* Bachelor’s and or advanced degree in a relevant field preferred, or equivalent work experience
* Demonstrated experience working in either a constituent-based or community engagement focused role, comfortable engaging with people from diverse backgrounds
* Knowledge of or experience working with Tribal Nations, historic and cultural preservation, and/or Section 106 Tribal consultation processes, while not required, is a plus
* Demonstrated multicultural competence – the awareness, knowledge, and skills needed to work with others who are culturally different in meaningful, relevant, and productive ways
* Strong communication, writing, organizational, and interpersonal skills as well as an enthusiasm for engaging with people
* Ability to manage simultaneous priorities in different venues without missing important deadlines or developments
* Proficiency with MS Office365, including strong Excel data analysis skills and PowerPoint presentation experience; experience with GIS software experience a plus
* Hybrid work model – must be able to work in our New Bedford, Boston, or New York office a minimum of three days per week

 **What you’ll get:**

* Flexible work schedule, including the option to work from home
* Competitive pay and generous benefits
* Fully funded HSA Plan with rollover
* Matching 401K contributions with immediate vesting
* Paid Parental Leave
* Inclusive work environment and company culture
* Opportunity to learn from industry experts

 **Who we are:**

*Vineyard Offshore* is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We take pride in allowing all team members to freely voice their opinions regardless of where they come from or what they look like. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an environment of inclusion for all members of our team. We truly believe that everyone deserves a seat at the table.

  

We are also actively seeking qualified United States (US) military veterans and service members who want to work in the offshore wind industry.

 *Agency and Third-Party Recruiter Notice:* *Agencies that* *submit* *a resume to Vineyard Offshore must have a current, fully executed Agency Agreement signed by a member of the Vineyard Offshore Legal team. In addition, Agencies may only* *submit* *candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Vineyard Offshore Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Vineyard Offshore Recruiter under these terms, or they will not be considered.*

title: Photogrammetry Specialist
description:
As an ideal candidate, you will excel in processing photogrammetry images captured our advanced aerial solutions. This role involves leading post-processing photogrammetry workflow i.e. Camera Calibration, Aerial Triangulation, Point Cloud generation, 3D Mesh creation, and leveraging expertise to create success stories through competitive analysis and webinars.  

We expect:* Process photogrammetry images captured by large format aerial cameras from Aerial Triangulation to generation of high quality deliverables e.g. Dense Point Clouds, Orthophotos, 3D Meshes.
* Lead camera calibration efforts, ensuring accuracy and consistency in data collection processes.
* Conduct Aerial Triangulation to establish ground control points and optimize data accuracy.
* Analyze competitive landscapes and translate success stories through comprehensive data analysis.
* Conduct engaging webinars and knowledge-sharing sessions showcasing our advanced technology and photogrammetry techniques.
* Engagement with Marketing team to produce contents for Go To Marketing activities

  

You bring:* Bachelor’s degree or higher in Geomatics, Remote Sensing, or related fields.
* Extensive experience (3 years) processing photogrammetry images from large format aerial cameras.
* Proficient in camera calibration, Aerial Triangulation, Point Cloud generation, and 3D mesh creation.
* Strong analytical skills to conduct competitive analysis and craft compelling success stories.
* Excellent communication skills for delivering engaging webinars and knowledge-sharing sessions.
  

  

Plus points:* Experience with market-leading photogrammetry software e.g. Trimble Inpho, ESRI ArcGIS Reality Studio.
* Master's degree in Photogrammetry
* Experience in Go To Marketing activities like webinars or producing videos
* Location in Colorado

title: Software Development Specialist
description:
**Company Overview**
At Hexagon US Federal we provide cutting-edge technologies and a wide range of professional services to enable our customers to make smarter and faster operational decisions and improve mission effectiveness.
Hexagon US Federal is an independent subsidiary of Hexagon Corporation exclusively focused on bringing the broad range of Hexagon technologies to the US Federal government and its partners. **Job Overview**
Geographic Information Systems (GIS) has always been a critical pillar to any System Integrator and Federal Government infrastructure. However, traditional GIS products are not well equipped to fully handle the challenges of today’s government needs.

The program focuses on modernizing the raster maps to automate the production of Compressed ARC Digitized Raster Graph (CADRG) and Enhanced Compressed Raster Graphics (ECRG) that are the primary foundation map background format for digital maps.

We’re seeking motivated, organized, and self-driven developers with the ability to develop and maintain applications, determine requirements, and perform demonstrations.  


### **Required Qualifications:**

* Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 7 - 10 years of experience
* Experience with Java
* Experience with Python
* Experience with GitLab and code repositories in general
* Experience with writing software unit tests
* Experience with Docker
* US Citizen
* Secret Security Clearance
* Ability to travel and support customer as needed

### **Desired Qualifications:**

* Knowledge of deploying OpenShift applications and traversing OpenShift Console
* Knowledge of Cloud Technologies (Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud)
* Knowledge of Geospatial Databases (Postgres/PostGIS, Oracle Spatial)
* Knowledge of GDAL, Ghostscript, and OpenCV
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies
* Please note: Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise and geographic region & may vary from the amount above. This range does not represent additional compensation benefits (such as sales commissions, short - and long - term incentive packages, 401K match, medical, dental or vision insurance).

**Required Level of Security Clearance:** Secret Clearance**Security Clearance Statement:** This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. **What we will provide in return:*** Competitive health care plans with savings accounts
* Dental and vision plans
* 401k with 100% company match up to 6%, with immediate vesting on company match
* Life and disability insurance
* Learning Management System with robust offerings
* Tuition Reimbursement Program
* Paid Time Off
* 13 paid holidays per year
* Thrive Wellness Program
* DE&I Committee with regular educational sessions and communications
* Leadership Development Program with multiple learning options



At Hexagon US Federal, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. We are pleased to offer a Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Program: this employee-led program offers monthly speakers, newsletters, training, outreach and more as well as VALOR (Veterans and Allies: Leadership, Outreach, Resources): our veterans’ employee resource group.  

We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, ability and more. If you need accommodations to make our process more accessible to you, please email us at hexusfed-hr@hexagonusfederal.com. We can’t wait to meet you!  

Hexagon US Federal is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

title: GIS Project Manager
description:
**Job Title : GIS Project Manager**

**Location : Remote**

**Duration : 12 Months/Full Time**

**Must have Gas in downstream ( Transmission and Distribution) Domain experience**

**Responsibilities:**

**Project Planning:**

* Develop and manage comprehensive project plans for GIS software development and data management initiatives in the gas domain.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define project requirements, objectives, and success criteria.
* Identify and address specific challenges associated with GIS applications in the gas industry.

**Team Leadership:**

* Lead multidisciplinary project teams, including GIS developers, data analysts, and domain experts.
* Foster a collaborative and goal-oriented team culture.
* Allocate resources effectively and ensure teams have the necessary tools and support for project success.

**GIS Software Development:**

* Oversee the development and implementation of complex GIS software solutions for the gas industry.
* Ensure adherence to GIS standards, best practices, and industry-specific regulations.
* Collaborate with GIS developers to address technical challenges and optimize software performance.

**Data Management:**

* Develop strategies for the acquisition, integration, and management of geospatial data related to gas infrastructure.
* Implement data quality standards, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with industry regulations.
* Oversee the design and optimization of spatial databases for efficient data retrieval and analysis.

**Regulatory Compliance:**

* Ensure that GIS software and data management practices comply with relevant regulatory requirements in the gas domain.
* Stay informed about industry standards and changes in regulations that may impact GIS projects.

**Client and Stakeholder Communication:**

* Serve as the primary point of contact for clients and stakeholders in the gas industry.
* Communicate project status, updates, and key milestones effectively.
* Address client concerns and ensure alignment with project goals.

**Timeline and Budget Management:**

* Develop and manage project timelines and budgets, considering the unique challenges of GIS projects in the gas domain.
* Monitor project expenditures and implement cost-saving measures when necessary.

**Risk Management:**

* Identify and mitigate risks associated with GIS software development and data management in the gas industry.
* Develop contingency plans to address unforeseen challenges.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in GIS, Geography, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Project Manager in ESRI / Schneider GIS software development and data management, preferably in the gas industry.
* Familiarity with gas infrastructure and regulatory requirements.
* Project Management Professional (PMP) or GIS Professional (GISP) certification is a plus.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a dynamic and regulated environment.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with ESRI / Schneider GIS software such as ArcGIS in the context of gas infrastructure.
* Knowledge of gas industry standards and data models.
* Familiarity with spatial analysis and modeling for gas-related applications.
* Background in managing projects involving spatial data integration and analysis.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* ArcGIS: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: BIA - Geospatial Administrator
description:
**Job Title:** Geospatial Administrator
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

The Geospatial Administrator role is to support our Bureau of Indian Affairs infrastructure environments. They deliver technical solutions and support to clients allowing them to maximize their investment in enterprise systems technologies.
  
  

**Duties/Responsibilities:**  

* Acts as and/or supports the database administrator for all GIS related processes and projects.
* Administer, design, build, and implement Esri enterprise geodatabases
* Management of MSSQL Server database operation, permissions, security, and capabilities in an enterprise environment
* Install, configure, and tune Esri SDE enterprise geodatabases in multiple development and production environments
* Administer security and access control of all database systems (user management, role-based security) using AD and SQL Server accounts
* Design and develop custom automation processes for administration and management of enterprise databases, geodatabases, and systems deployment
* Database programming and scripting (SQL/T-SQL) within SQL Server environment and automation of geodatabase administration and management using Esri Python API, ArcGIS REST APIs, shell & batch scripting
* Development and management of distributed geodatabases (replication, archiving, versioning)
* Backup and restore enterprise geodatabases using full and point-in-time methods
* Perform regular and ongoing monitoring of database disk space availability and use
* Document all system processes and scripts used to keep the geodatabases fully operational
* Utilize issue tracking system (Jira, Remedy) to manage technical issues and tasks
* Consult with departments in the development of their GIS data management plans, goals and objectives.
* Upgrade versions and maintain licenses for SQL Server and Esri enterprise geodatabases.
* Advises clientele on system and data security with their IT and security counterparts.
* Advises and assists with migration to cloud based platforms (AWS, MS Azure, etc.…)
* Other duties assigned.


**Required Skills/Abilities:**  

* Understanding of enterprise computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging computing trends
* Ability to research and learn new technologies independently (self-motivated)
* Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
* Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through
* Detail oriented with exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills, strong customer service orientation
* Ability to work in a remote/telecommuting team-based environment.
* Sensitivity to the BIA’s sister programs/agencies and Tribal end client.


**Education and Experience:**  

* Bachelor of Science degree in the field of computer science, information technology or equivalent experience
* Five years (seven preferred) demonstrated relevant experience in GIS technology, database administration, and systems administration
* ArcGIS SDE geodatabase administration within an Esri/Windows Server/SQL Server environment
* Experience with version control and Continuous Integration systems (eg. Git, Jenkins)
* Experience with Esri technology, Python, SQL/T-SQL, or other scripting/geospatial application development tools


**Working Conditions:**  

The physical and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

**Physical Demands:**  

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to walk, use hands to finger, handle objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; balance; stoop; bending or crouching; talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
* Some lifting of files, opening cabinets.
* Bending or standing as necessary.


**Work Environment:** While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to weather conditions and other elements prevalent at the time.
  
This description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills or working conditions associated with the position. It is intended to accurately reflect the activities and requirements of the position, but duties may be added, deleted, or modified, as necessary. This description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.
  
  

Who is Sealaska? Established in 1972, Sealaska is the Alaska Native regional corporation for Southeast Alaska. Our 23,000 shareholders are Tlingit, Haida and Tsimshian people with more than 10,000 years of ancestral ties to the oceans, forests and communities of Southeast Alaska. We serve the twin goals of economic prosperity and environmental protection. Managed Business Solutions is a subsidiary of Sealaska.
  
  

We are committed to providing the best possible climate for maximum development and goal achievement for all our employees. As a subsidiary of a Native-owned company, Managed Business Solutions, LLC is proud to promote an inclusive and diverse workplace, with respect for the cultural traditions in the communities where we operate.
  
  

Managed Business Solutions, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants are considered without regard to age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status or physical disability. However, preference may be extended to an enrolled member of a federally-recognized Indian Tribe\\*
  
  

* “Indian Tribe” means an Indian Tribe, band, nation, or other organized group or community, including any Alaska Native village or regional or village corporation as defined in or established pursuant to the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act (85 Stat. 668; 43 U.S.C. 1601) which is recognized as eligible for the special programs and services provided by the United States to Indians because of their status as Indians.

title: GIS Project Manager
description:
**Job Title : GIS Project Manager**

**Location : Remote**

**Duration : 12 Months/Full Time**

**Must have Gas in downstream ( Transmission and Distribution) Domain experience**

**Responsibilities:**

**Project Planning:**

* Develop and manage comprehensive project plans for GIS software development and data management initiatives in the gas domain.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define project requirements, objectives, and success criteria.
* Identify and address specific challenges associated with GIS applications in the gas industry.

**Team Leadership:**

* Lead multidisciplinary project teams, including GIS developers, data analysts, and domain experts.
* Foster a collaborative and goal-oriented team culture.
* Allocate resources effectively and ensure teams have the necessary tools and support for project success.

**GIS Software Development:**

* Oversee the development and implementation of complex GIS software solutions for the gas industry.
* Ensure adherence to GIS standards, best practices, and industry-specific regulations.
* Collaborate with GIS developers to address technical challenges and optimize software performance.

**Data Management:**

* Develop strategies for the acquisition, integration, and management of geospatial data related to gas infrastructure.
* Implement data quality standards, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and compliance with industry regulations.
* Oversee the design and optimization of spatial databases for efficient data retrieval and analysis.

**Regulatory Compliance:**

* Ensure that GIS software and data management practices comply with relevant regulatory requirements in the gas domain.
* Stay informed about industry standards and changes in regulations that may impact GIS projects.

**Client and Stakeholder Communication:**

* Serve as the primary point of contact for clients and stakeholders in the gas industry.
* Communicate project status, updates, and key milestones effectively.
* Address client concerns and ensure alignment with project goals.

**Timeline and Budget Management:**

* Develop and manage project timelines and budgets, considering the unique challenges of GIS projects in the gas domain.
* Monitor project expenditures and implement cost-saving measures when necessary.

**Risk Management:**

* Identify and mitigate risks associated with GIS software development and data management in the gas industry.
* Develop contingency plans to address unforeseen challenges.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in GIS, Geography, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience as a Project Manager in ESRI / Schneider GIS software development and data management, preferably in the gas industry.
* Familiarity with gas infrastructure and regulatory requirements.
* Project Management Professional (PMP) or GIS Professional (GISP) certification is a plus.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent organizational and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a dynamic and regulated environment.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with ESRI / Schneider GIS software such as ArcGIS in the context of gas infrastructure.
* Knowledge of gas industry standards and data models.
* Familiarity with spatial analysis and modeling for gas-related applications.
* Background in managing projects involving spatial data integration and analysis.

Job Type: Contract

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Drone Surveying and 3D Modeling Specialist /Software Developer
description:
**Description**
===============



.


**Summary:**



Our team is seeking a multi-faceted Drone Surveying and 3D Modeling Specialist with a strong background in software development to support our construction survey operations. This role is central to conducting drone inspections, creating precise 3D models, and enhancing or developing in-house software tools to optimize data processing and model hosting. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of drone technology, 3D modeling, and software development principles, particularly as they apply to the construction industry.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**

  


* Pilot drones to capture detailed images and data for surveying construction sites and architectural projects.
* Transform aerial data into highly accurate 3D models using advanced processing techniques.
* Ensure 3D models are accurate and hosted on platforms for easy access and manipulation by project stakeholders.
* Develop, enhance, and maintain in-house software tools and applications to streamline the surveying and modeling processes.
* Write and debug code for various aspects of the platform, ensuring robustness and efficiency.
* Work with cross-functional teams to understand needs and deliver software solutions that aid in data interpretation and decision-making.
* Conduct ongoing testing and improvement of software tools, incorporating feedback from users to enhance functionality.
* Provide technical support and training for software and tools developed in-house.

  


**Qualifications:**

  


* Demonstrable experience in UAV operation, with a strong portfolio of survey work that has utilized drones.
* Advanced skills in 3D modeling and proficiency in relevant software (such as CAD, GIS, photogrammetry software).
* Experience in software development, with a solid grasp of programming languages relevant to the field (e.g., Python, C++, JavaScript).
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle and experience with software development tools (e.g., Git, JIRA).
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to approach problems logically and systematically.
* FAA Part 107 certification or equivalent for commercial drone operations is mandatory.
* Exceptional attention to detail and a keen eye for identifying data discrepancies.

  


**Preferred Skills:**

  


* Experience with Microsoft Power Pages
* Experience with cloud-based platforms and services (AWS, Azure, etc.) for deploying and managing applications.
* Knowledge of machine learning and AI techniques as they pertain to image recognition and data analysis.
* Proven ability to document and explain code in a clear and concise manner.

  



The successful candidate will be at the forefront of integrating surveying technology with custom software solutions to drive innovation in the construction industry. If you have a passion for cutting-edge technology and a desire to build software that makes an impact, we encourage you to apply.



Our ideal candidate is an innovative but decisive engineer who can work effectively in a fast moving highly collaborative, team-based environment; has the ability to set goals and expectations and hold others accountable; can encourage and mentor others; is approachable, empathetic and outgoing; can quickly gain trust and respect; and is able to establish and maintain relationships.



STRUCTURAL TECHNOLOGIES is proud of a company culture that promotes 24/7 safety and quality. We offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical and dental insurance, 401(k), paid holidays, vacation, tuition reimbursement, career development and growth opportunities, and a caring work environment. EOE/M/F/D/V

title: Environmental Specialist (Scientist II) – REMOTE
description:
Sundance Consulting, Inc. is expanding our team and actively looking for dynamic individuals who are following their passion in delivering the highest-quality project work. Our team is looking for self-motivated junior-, mid-, and senior-level NEPA practitioners with attention to detail and strong communication skills to serve an existing federal contract. Individuals need to be willing and able to work with peers across various offices and accomplish tasks associated with a variety of projects in any given week. The ability to work directly with clients is imperative.


Sundance Consulting, Inc. (www.sundance-inc.net) is a Native-Owned/Woman-Owned, award-winning environmental and natural/cultural resources Small Business. Our success has been rewarded by a deep backlog of work and we look forward to continuing to accomplish our goals. We value your innovative thinking, technical expertise, business skills, and your ability to engage with our clients and our project teams. If you are a high-achiever with a client-focus and a passion for quality, innovative solutions, and environmental stewardship, you will be a perfect match with us.


We offer a competitive benefits package that includes paid holidays, paid time off, medical, dental, & vision insurance, disability/life/ADD insurance, and a 401(k) with a generous matching program. All candidates must be able to pass a pre-employment drug test and federal background check.


**Compensation and Benefits**

* Salary Range up to $67,000
* Bonus Program.
* Flexible working hours are available, outside of scheduled field events, allowing for a half day off every Friday.
* Medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, paid time off, and 401(k) with a 4% match.

**Summary of Position**


The Scientist II will lead and support environmental reviews of documents submitted by third-party preparers, coordinate with project applicants and consultants for additional information, and serve as signatory on environmental compliance documents. Environmental compliance activities primarily will include reviews of Categorical Exclusions with supporting environmental documentation, reviewing/signing compliance documents, providing technical guidance to junior staff, and supporting the NEPA Project Manager.

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's degree in biology, archaeology, geology, natural or environmental sciences, or related field.
* 5 years of environmental compliance and review experience; or 3 years with a master's degree in a related field.
* Experience reviewing environmental documents for technical and regulatory completeness.
* Knowledge of environmental regulations.
* Experience working with state and federal regulatory agencies a plus.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and aptitude.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Self-starter, flexible team player, willing/able to work on a wide variety of tasks.
* Proficiency with MS Office suite, Microsoft Teams, Adobe products, and GIS.

 **Preferred Qualifications**

* 5+ years' experience working with NEPA documentation and/or environmental permitting.
* Experience reviewing and writing CEs; experience with developing EAs a plus.

Strong background or expertise in one or more environmental regulations, such as biological resources, cultural resources, hazardous materials, Clean Water Act permitting, or Environmental Justice.  
* 

  

  

*Sundance is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation. Reasonable accommodations may*

*be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.*
