title: Sr. Staff/Professional Environmental or Coastal Engineer
description:
Overview:

Do you want to build an impactful career to change the world for the better?


We are actively hiring **Senior Staff or Professional Coastal or** **Environmental** **Engineers** to join our growing sediment & waterfront practice in the United States**.** The successful candidates will ideally be based near one of our offices in **Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New Jersey or Pennsylvania,** however for established consultants we are also able to consider **remote working**. You will apply engineering skills to projects involving investigations, design, and construction support for coastal resiliency projects and the remediation of sediment sites throughout the United States, while further developing the business skills needed for a successful consulting career.  

Geosyntec is an innovative, international engineering and consulting firm serving private and public-sector clients to address new ventures and complex problems involving our environment, natural resources, and civil infrastructure. Our engineers, scientists, technical and project employees serve our clients from offices across the world. Ranked by ENR as one of the top environmental engineering design firms, Geosyntec is internationally known for its technical leadership, broad experience, and exceptional client service.  

We invest in our people. Each employee is unique, and your career at Geosyntec will be too. We offer competitive pay and benefits, and well-being programs to support you and your family.  

To Learn More Visit: http://www.geosyntec.com/careers/.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
**Coastal Engineering**

* Design and implement coastal protection and stabilization projects.
* Conduct coastal vulnerability assessments and develop mitigation strategies.
* Analyze wave, tide, and current data to inform coastal infrastructure design.
* Provide expertise in beach nourishment and erosion control methods.
* Design and oversee the construction of coastal structures such as breakwaters and seawalls.
* Collaborate with environmental agencies to ensure compliance with coastal regulations.

**Remediation Design**

* Develop innovative and sustainable solutions for sediment remediation projects.
* Conduct site assessments and characterize contaminated sediments for remediation planning.
* Design and implement sediment containment and treatment systems.
* Collaborate with environmental scientists to develop comprehensive remediation strategies.
* Ensure compliance with environmental regulations and permitting requirements.
* Evaluate and select appropriate remediation technologies based on site-specific conditions.

**Environmental Monitoring and Assessment:**

* Implement monitoring programs to assess the effectiveness of remediation efforts.
* Conduct environmental impact assessments for coastal and waterfront projects.
* Analyze water and sediment quality data to inform project design and optimization.
* Stay informed about emerging trends and technologies in environmental monitoring.


Education and Licensure:
* Bachelor's degree in civil, water resources, coastal or environmental engineering, or a related field of study. (required)
* Advanced degree in the same. (preferred but not essential)
* Professional registration (i.e., E.I.T. or P.E.) (preferred)


Skills, Experience and Qualifications:
* At least 2 years of related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. (required)
* Ability to digest and summarize technical language from white papers, reports or regulatory documents. (required)
* Technical experience in engineering, geology, geotechnical, environmental, or related disciplines. (preferred)
* Previous field experience, for example coastal vulnerability assessments, sediment sampling, porewater sampling, observation of well installation, soil sampling, groundwater sampling, and/or other field techniques. (preferred)
* Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to environmental remediation. (valuable)
* Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Access, and related software; GIS. (preferred)
* Excellent writing and communication skills. (required)
* Valid U.S. driver’s license and a satisfactory driving record for business travel. (required)

title: Project Support Specialist, Gas
description:
Overview: **Company Summary**MasTec Professional Services provides results-driven engineering, design, and integrated services to the power, oil & gas pipeline, and gas distribution industries. With a genesis in construction and a skilled team of multidiscipline engineers and project management professionals, we deliver end-to-end solutions for infrastructure projects across the country. Committed to excellence in every aspect of our work, we create collaborative partnerships with our clients by building trust and consistently delivering the highest standards of performance.

  



MasTec Professional Services Company is a subsidiary of MasTec, a certified Minority-Controlled Company by the National Minority Supplier Development Council (NMSDC).

  


Responsibilities: **Job Summary**


The Project Support Specialist, Gas role requires working with a team to prepare and deliver contractor work packages for field utility work.


* Review package materials such as CAD plans, GIS maps and detail instruction sheets for quality control and safety checks.
* Get packages printed and combined for delivery to utility offices in Baltimore.
* Ability to work both independently and in tandem with a team of internal, client and contractor personnel.
* Enter and track field information prior to field work and post construction.
* Ability to deliver documentation to Baltimore City office(s) in a timely manner and pick up materials at printers etc.
* Office visits may be required once or multiple times per week depending on work load, 10% travel. This is an absolute requirement.

  


Qualifications:  

* Demonstrated understanding of gas utility design and operations is preferred but not required.
* Good interpersonal communication skills.
* Strong Microsoft office applications skills, especially Excel.
* Strong admin skills such as organization and good eye for detail.
* Preferred candidate should have easy travel access to Baltimore City and be able to go into office as needed.

 **Preferred Skills*** Experience with simple database creation and maintenance is a plus.

title: Hazard Mitigation Specialist
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to join a team that makes a real difference? Do you want to be part of a collaborative team that protects and strengthens communities and businesses? If you are looking for all these opportunities and more, then Witt O’Brien’s is the right fit for you.
Position Summary
Witt O'Brien's is seeking an innovative, motivated, and talented Hazard Mitigation Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be able to showcase their technical expertise and project delivery skills in the Hazard Mitigation arena and ensure quality product delivery to our clients through programs like FEMA 406, HMGP, BRIC, FMA, and PDM as well as CDBG-MIT. The Hazard Mitigation Specialist may travel to disaster-impacted areas to support Witt O'Brien's clients in the delivery of trans- and post-recovery assistance.
The Hazard Mitigation Specialist is responsible for: providing clients strategic advice regarding developing, analyzing, and preparing mitigation recommendations utilizing mitigation funding sources that promote resiliency. The position will include, but is not limited to, the identification, development, and review of technical federal applications for structural mitigation projects such as flood proofing structures, elevation of flood prone structures, soil stabilization, storm water management, and other flood control projects. You will position and develop hazard mitigation projects and review grant and subgrant applications to maximize mitigation participation and funding.
Other responsibilities include development of hazard mitigation plans that are compliant with FEMA Section 201. Mitigation planning tasks include conducting stakeholder engagement meetings and interviews to collect data, assisting with plan research and data collection / management, and assisting with hazard vulnerability and risk assessment and mitigation strategy technical writing.
Position Details* Reports to: Mitigation Director
* Location: Remote
* Position Type: On-Call
* FLSA Status: Non-Exempt
* Pay: Hourly
* Compensation: Commensurate with experience
* Travel: Client Dependent – Approx. 15%


Essential Job Functions* Provides client-facing technical consulting on program policy and procedures
* Manages projects, as needed, using company standard project management principles
* Reviews projects to identify and develop hazard mitigation projects
* Performs visits to site inspections to identify possible mitigation measures
* Provides guidance on the FEMA Sections 404, 406, BRIC, FMA, and PDM Hazard Mitigation Programs as well as the HUD CDBG-MIT program
* Assists with development and review of benefit cost analysis
* Advises on grant and subgrant applications to maximize mitigation participation and funding
* Excellent customer service skill set, ability to listen and facilitate work through completion
* Provide guidance on FEMA Section 201 mitigation planning requirements
* Stakeholder engagement and interviews to collect data
* Assist with plan research and data collection / management
* Assist with mitigation plan technical writing
* Travel for projects as needed
* Assist with technical approach proposal writing
* Other duties as assigned


Minimum Job Requirements* Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of experience
* Experience in mitigation at FEMA, State, Local Level, or private consulting
* Knowledge of Federal and State Mitigation programs and initiatives, including HMGP, BRIC, FMA, and CDBG-MIT
* Knowledge and experience with engineering principles and practices as they relate to HM programs
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects in a changing work environment
* Ability to work independently and / or on a team
* Strong organizational and research skills
* Comfortable interacting with clients and client stakeholders
* Proficient computer skills: including MS Teams, MS Word, MS Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat


Preferred Job Requirements* Benefit Cost Analysis experience
* GIS and HAZUS-MH skills are ideal but not required
* Experience with Hazard Mitigation Planning or equivalent
* Experience with FEMA Mitigation Programs or equivalent

  

Job Description and Hiring Disclaimer
This position description incorporates the core responsibilities of the job. It recognizes that other related duties not specifically mentioned might also be performed, and that not all responsibilities may be carried out depending on operational needs.
The hiring department will conduct interviews of qualified individuals prior to requesting a criminal background check, and no job application submitted prior to such interview shall inquire into an applicant's criminal history. If this position is subject to a background check for any convictions related to its responsibilities and requirements, employment will be contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history. Criminal history will not automatically disqualify a candidate.
Commitment to Diversity* Witt O'Brien's is always looking for the most qualified and experienced professionals with a passion for public safety, emergency management, homeland security, disaster response, and continuity of operations.
* We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Veteran/Disabled
With you when it counts.

title: Senior GIS Consultant
description:
Job ID# SCC0219 – Posted 11/10/2023 – Remote



#### **Position Description**


Typical Deliverables:


* The consultant will perform the QAQC of the parcel fabric data converted by a thirdparty vendor.
* The consultant will perform the parcel editing in the production system after the data is accepted.
* QAQC


o The consultant completes the assigned QAQC area within the deadline set by the project manager. There will be 8 separate deliveries where QAQC needs to be performed. QAQC of each delivery must be completed within 4 weeks.  

o The consultant documents the errors during the QAQC and iteratively review until all errors are resolved.  

o Production editing  

o After each delivery of the parcel fabric data is accepted, the data will be loaded into production system. The consultant edits the parcels in production parcel fabric environment.


#### **Skills Required**


* ArcGIS Pro
* Parcel Fabric within ArcGIS Pro or ArcMap
* Ability to interprete drawings in CAD
* QAQC methods of parcel fabric data
#### **Experience Required**


1. ArcGIS Pro and COGO Software Proficiency  

a. Proficiency in using GIS (Geographic Information Systems) software, as well as specialized COGO software packages (e.g., AutoCAD, ArcGIS Pro/ArcMap with Parcel Fabric, etc.).  

b. Experience with parcel fabric editing in Esri’s Parcel Fabric within ArcGIS Pro or ArcMap.  

c. Experience with multi-user editing environment  

d. Understanding of parcel fabric data models and how they function within ArcGIS Pro or ArcMap.  

e. A strong understanding of Coordinate Geometry (COGO) principles, including the use of bearings, distances, angles, and coordinate transformations.



2. Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC)  

a. Ability to implement rigorous QA/QC processes to ensure data accuracy and integrity.  

b. Legal Knowledge  

c. Familiarity with local, state, and federal land surveying laws, regulations, and standards, as well as the principles of land boundary and parcel determination.  

d. Ability to interpret legal descriptions for land parcels.  

e. Awareness of local and state regulations related to land parcel data and GIS standards.


#### **Education Required**


Bachelor’s degree in geographic information systems, geography, land surveying, civil engineering, geomatics, or related field.


#### **Notes**


* Nexlogica reserves the right to contact only selected candidates.

title: Ecologist
description:
Role Summary


WSP is seeking a **Principal** **Marine Ecologist** (with marine / Fresh water expertise) to join our large and growing technical support team in India (Noida/Bangalore) to work with our UK wide ecology team.


The successful applicant will be a part of the aquatic ecology team - a technical specialist group within the wider ecology team - that covers marine and freshwater ecology. data handling / map making professionals who will be part of WSP iCRC UK Ecology Team, delivering the highest standards of technical work and aiding the continued success of the ecology business by assisting us in our client focused delivery of projects.


The work will be focussed on providing design, mapping support, including GIS deliverables and interpretation if required of the raw survey information gathered by ecologists in the UK. Deliverables will be used in reports and assessments provided to our clients for a range of different commercial and scientific sectors.


Responsibilities

* Managing a portfolio of diverse and interesting aquatic ecology projects and producing high quality technical reports.
* Supporting our UK wide projects in transitional, coastal, marine and/or freshwater environments in the UK and beyond.
* Preparing supporting information for investigations of European Protected Species
* Supporting the technical and professional development of the team of aquatic ecologists and/or learning and developing new skills with opportunity to influence peers.
* Actively promoting knowledge sharing with an inclusive nature, developing working relations with all aspects of WSP, gaining internal and international clients along the way
* You’ll have a visible role within the business, interacting with other ecology team leads across the UK.


Key Competencies / Skills


Mandatory skills

* Competent ecologist with marine and/or aquatic background having strong UK experience.
* 10-15 years of experience in the relevant field
* Experience in supporting technical assessments for EIA, Habitat Regulation Assessment (HRA) and Water Framework Directives (WFD), planning processes, and ecological assessments.
* Understanding the impacts of developmental activities on the species and on the various habitats like, transitional, coastal, marine and/or freshwater environments handling and managing large data sets for map making
* Are confident and highly motivated, with good communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.


Desirable Skills

* Experience of Ecological Consultancy or working within the field of conservation
* Chartered member of CIEEM (Chartered Institute of Ecology and Environmental Management) or capable of applying for it.
* Proficiency in wildlife legislation, planning processes, and ecological assessments.
* Demonstrated experience in report writing, and quality assurance.
* Knowledge of Biodiversity Net Gain (BNG) principles.


Qualifications

* Have a master’s degree in a Zoology / Biological science with specialisation in marine or aquatic.
* 10-15 years of experience in the relevant field

title: Urban Governance Specialist
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our team as an Urban Governance Specialist. This role sits at the intersection of public administration, urban planning, public policy, and legal expertise relevant to India. It requires a deep understanding of the complex dynamics shaping modern cities and a commitment to promoting inclusive and sustainable urban development.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Policy Development and Analysis:** Collaborate with stakeholders to develop, review, and analyze urban policies and regulations aimed at improving governance structures, enhancing public service delivery, and fostering inclusive urban development. Utilize expertise in public administration, urban planning, public policy, and Indian legal frameworks to ensure alignment with legal requirements and best practices.
* **Legal Compliance and Regulatory Oversight:** Stay abreast of relevant laws, regulations, and policies impacting urban governance in India. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and provide guidance on regulatory matters related to urban planning, land use, zoning, and environmental sustainability.
* **Capacity Building and Training:** Design and facilitate training programs and workshops for government officials, urban planners, and community leaders to strengthen their understanding of governance principles, legal frameworks, and best practices in urban management. Incorporate insights from public administration, urban planning, and public policy disciplines to enhance capacity-building efforts.
* **Community Engagement and Participation:** Promote community engagement initiatives to foster dialogue, collaboration, and participatory decision-making processes in urban governance. Utilize expertise in public policy and urban planning to facilitate partnerships between local authorities, civil society organizations, and residents to address community needs and priorities.
* **Data Analysis and Performance Monitoring:** Utilize data analytics tools and methodologies to assess the effectiveness of governance interventions, track key performance indicators, and identify areas for improvement in urban service delivery, transparency, and accountability. Draw on knowledge from public administration and urban planning to inform evidence-based decision-making processes.
* **Strategic Planning and Stakeholder Coordination:** Contribute to the development of strategic plans and action agendas to guide urban development initiatives. Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders to align objectives, mobilize resources, and implement collaborative projects that advance urban governance goals. Integrate insights from public policy and legal expertise to ensure strategic alignment and effectiveness.
* **Research and Knowledge Sharing:** Conduct research on emerging trends, innovative approaches, and lessons learned in the field of urban governance. Disseminate knowledge through publications, presentations, and knowledge-sharing platforms to inform policy debates and promote evidence-based decision-making. Apply expertise in public administration, urban planning, public policy, and Indian legal frameworks to generate actionable insights and recommendations.

**Qualifications:**

* Advanced degree in Public Administration, Urban Planning, Public Policy, Law (LLB or equivalent), or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in urban governance, public policy analysis, legal compliance, or related areas, with expertise relevant to India.
* In-depth knowledge of urban laws, regulatory frameworks, and governance mechanisms in India, coupled with strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data.
* Excellent communication, facilitation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage diverse stakeholders and build consensus around shared goals.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools, GIS software, and other relevant technologies is desirable.
* Demonstrated commitment to promoting equity, diversity, and inclusion in urban development initiatives.

title: GIS Officer
description:
**OFFICE LOCATION**
-------------------

  


Preferred location New Delhi (we are open to anywhere in India)

  


**WHO WE ARE**
--------------

  


**ORGANIZATIONAL OVERVIEW: A PIONEER IN CONSERVATION LEADERSHIP**


This is an exciting time at The Nature Conservancy (TNC) as we are shifting our strategy for greater impact in the world, seeking to address some of the most complex challenges facing people and nature — issues such as climate change, conserving lands, waters, and oceans at unprecedented scale, providing food and water sustainably and helping make cities more resilient and sustainable.


For more details please visit to our website: https://www.nature.org/en-us/


Nature Conservancy India Solutions Private Limited (NCIS) is one of the group entity of The Nature Conservancy (TNC). NCIS is a private limited company incorporated under the Companies Act 2013, having it registered office in India in New Delhi. India. The company currently provides technical consultancy, monitoring & evaluation, and other related services in the domain of conservation and environment to its various clients within and outside India. NCIS helps its clients in achieving their environmental and conservation targets by providing science-based solutions and technical support. NCIS has been providing services to its various clients for last three years in India.

  

**WHAT WE CAN ACHIEVE TOGETHER**
--------------------------------

  


GIS Officer is responsible for development, direction, and management of all geospatial and related technological activities within the India Program. The GIS officer works closely with the science and program teams on different projects and provides geospatial data and analysis support. This position is a leader on the team who helps identify and progress opportunities related to GIS, technology, and partnerships that help to leverage our conservation work.


Location: Preferred location New Delhi (subject to change as per project requirements)  

Tenure: Two years (with an option to renew based on performance and funding availability)


The GIS officer oversees and implements GIS, technology and innovation needs of the program. This role involves coordinating the geospatial and related technological activities between internal and external sources and builds internal and external relationships. Some key functions include:

* Data Management: Lead the process of building and maintaining a spatial data and tools library for ongoing and future conservation projects.
* Integrate Geospatial program: Build and implement a shared vision across the program team to integrate geospatial and related technologies in TNC-India’s programs during all stages of a project – planning, implementation, and monitoring & evaluation – to advance TNC science-based conservation strategies. This includes but not limited to activities like developing predictive models, integrating spatial data with field surveys, conducting landscape analyses to assess ecological integrity, identifying potential priority sites using modeling tools, spatial conservation action planning, developing and implementing decision support tools.
* Geospatial Technology: Work with TNC scientists to define problem statements and the role of geospatial technologies in addressing them, including development of new tools, approaches, methods, processes, and techniques to improve conservation actions.
* Partnerships: Build partnerships with relevant geospatial and data science agencies and universities in India. Work to advance other appropriate commercial technology partnerships.
* Program Management and Execution: Plan, manage, execute, and coordinate relevant projects and/or project work streams. Over time, identify the need for, and oversee additional related capacity (e.g., short-term or long-term interns, manager, analyst, specialist or technician). Identify, negotiate, and oversee contracts with vendors. Develop and manage program budget and integrate geospatial and technology budgets into program proposals and budgets as necessary.
* Significant opportunity to act independently within broad program goals.
* In supervisory capacity, plans, organizes and directs assigned project programs.
* Supervises project staff of managers, analysts, specialists, and technicians.
* May negotiate and contract with vendors.
**WE'RE LOOKING FOR YOU**
-------------------------

  


**Roles and responsibilities:**

* Broad conceptualization, execution, management, and leadership responsibility for all geospatial and technology work, including setting programmatic objectives, and identifying and bringing on additional capacity as needed (e.g., interns, consultants, full time permanent or project hires).
* Ensure that global and field-based projects utilize cutting edge geospatial technology and science to help address large-scale, complex problems by leveraging internal and external capacity, and systematic and thorough processes.
* Coordinate a multidisciplinary team, including responsibility for team engagement, and staff management (objective setting, coaching, and mentoring).
* Conduct spatial planning of land, water, and oceans across India.
* Designs, directs, and/or executes complex and diversified projects, coordinating the work of other professionals, managing budgets, and ensuring geospatial and technology program accountability.
* Build a geospatial data library with necessary data and tools to guide conservation work across India
* Meet the program’s spatial analysis needs across our programmatic areas and major initiatives.
* Undertake analysis for landscape-level, land-use and conservation planning.
* Provide technical coordination and support of geospatial activities between members of TNC-India team, TNC-Global teams, and project partners.
* Take leadership and project management roles when necessary.
* Build and maintain partnerships with key institutions.
* Collect spatial data and prepare maps to assist in effective communication and writing of reports and proposals.
* Respond to requests for geospatial information from partners and provide interpretation, as needed.
* Assist with other programmatic needs which may include coordinating stakeholder meetings, preparing presentations and reports related to geospatial and related technological activities, etc.
* Work independently and exercise independent judgment to identify and solve problems.
* Demonstrate sensitivity in handling confidential information.
* Ensure compliance with TNC policies and procedures and external (donor/legal/IRS) requirements.
* Manage assigned tasks, coordinating the work of a broader TNC team, and achieving deadlines.
* Identify and integrate technology solutions and opportunities working with the science and program teams.
* Resolves large-scale, complex problems through systematic studies and analyses, including the creation or improvement of techniques and procedures.
* Designs, implements, and directs complex and diverse projects to identify creative solutions, encompassing multiple programs and coordinating the work of other professionals inside and outside the organization.
* Incorporates cross-disciplinary knowledge to support program objectives
**WHAT YOU'LL BRING**
---------------------

  


**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* MS degree in Geography, GIS, remote sensing, geospatial science, conservation science, Computer Science or related field and 5-10 years related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Experience in designing and maintaining enterprise-scale spatial and relational databases to meet organizational needs.
* Experience in developing and managing multiple projects.
* Supervisory experience, including ability to motivate, lead, set objectives and manage performance.
* Experience administering a budget.
* Experience training individuals and groups.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Master’s degree and 8-15 years of experience or equivalent combination.
* Current Project Management certification highly preferred.
* Good knowledge of the data sources and availability with NRSC, FSI, WII, other central/regional/state/local departments
* Advanced experience in analysis with Google Earth Engine, and other similar tools will be highly beneficial.
* Working knowledge of scripting languages (esp. Python, SQL, and R) for conducting automated, complex, and high-level geospatial analysis.
* Advanced expertise in the use of Geographic Information Systems (e.g. Esri ArcGIS Pro and extensions, QGIS, MapInfo, etc.) and Remote Sensing Software (e.g. Leica Geosystems ERDAS Imagine, ENVI, Feature Analyst, Google Earth Engine etc.)
* Working knowledge in creating and maintaining internet-based spatial data viewers, interactive online analysis tools and spatial data distribution tools.
* Working knowledge of relevant scripting and programming languages (e.g.Python, R, Microsoft VBA, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc.).
* Experience creating standardized cartographic map design and spatial data visualization products for static and dynamic (Internet-based) map applications.
* Experience with server and online GIS applications.
* Experience managing big data, knowledge and use of country and international spatial databases directly relevant for India.
* Experience and knowledge of application of various remote sensing data for monitoring land, ocean and water resources
* Experience and knowledge of application of various geospatial analysis and tools in spatial conservation planning
* Develop alternate/new strategies, analytical pathways to carry out established geospatial analysis and tasks to achieve various program goals.
* Experience with project management and effective coordination across internal and external stakeholders.
* Strong ability to understand and analyze business processes and the use of technology by different facets of the organization.
* Experience managing all aspects of contracting with consultants and vendors.
* Proficiency in working independently as well as jointly with colleagues on a team.
* Good communication skills and ability to present complex information to a wide range of stakeholders.
* Experience with technology, including cloud computing, machine learning, and AI.
* Able to act with initiative and to take responsibility.
* Ability to think critically and “out of the box” with a problem-solving approach.
* Willingness to work flexible hours to accommodate international staff and time differences.


**APPLY NOW**
-------------

  


To apply for job ID **54809**, submit your materials online by using the Apply Now button at https://careers.nature.org/ by 11:59 PM IST on 22-March-2024. Need help applying? Visit our recruitment page or contact applyhelp@tnc.org.

**The Nature Conservancy is an Equal Opportunity Employer**. Our commitment to diversity includes the recognition that our conservation mission is best advanced by the leadership and contributions of people of diverse backgrounds, beliefs and culture. Recruiting and mentoring staff to create an inclusive organization that reflects our global character is a priority and we encourage applicants from all cultures, races, colors, religions, sexes, national or regional origins, ages, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military, protected veteran status or other status protected by law.

***The successful applicant must meet the requirements of The Nature Conservancy's background screening process.***


Do you have military experience? Visit our U.S. Military Skills Translator to match your military experience with our current job openings!


TNC is committed to offering accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please send a note to applyhelp@tnc.org with *Request for Accommodation* in the subject line.

*An attractive salary and benefits package is part of TNC’s value proposition to our employees. TNC strives to provide competitive pay and bases salaries on the geographic location of the role committing to being equitable across groups and providing hiring salary ranges when possible.*

*Since we support flexible and remote work for our employees, many positions have a flexible location* *within countries where we’re registered as a Non-government Organization and established as* *an employer. This may mean we’re unable to provide a hiring salary range in the posting for some of our positions. However, candidates invited to be part of our interview process will be provided their location specific range upon request.*

title: GIS Developer
description:
Position: GIS Developer and AI/ML Specialist

Location: Bangalore

Type: Full-time

Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled GIS Developer and AI/ML Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in geospatial analysis, web mapping technologies, database management with GIS extensions, and experience with various GIS software. This role involves multitasking across research and development, training, and software development to innovate and implement geospatial solutions for environmental and conservation projects.

Responsibilities:

- Develop and enhance GIS web applications using technologies like ESRI JavaScript API, OpenLayers, or Leaflet API.

- Conduct AI/ML training sessions covering topics from basic machine learning concepts to advanced geospatial analysis applications.

- Engage in research and development to explore new ways of applying AI/ML in geospatial contexts, including landslide susceptibility mapping and air quality prediction.

- Manage and analyze geospatial data using databases like PostgreSQL and extensions like PostGIS, ensuring quality and accuracy for spatial analysis.

- Utilize GIS software (ArcGIS, ArcGIS Pro, QGIS) for remote sensing and advanced geospatial modeling.

- Implement and maintain GIS servers such as ArcGIS Enterprise or GeoServer for project needs.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor's/Master's degree in GIS, Computer Science, Environmental Science, or a related field.

- Strong proficiency in Python and relevant libraries (e.g., numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, GeoPandas, GDAL).

- Expertise in web mapping technologies (ESRI JavaScript API, OpenLayers, Leaflet) and GIS servers (ArcGIS Enterprise, GeoServer).

- Solid understanding of database management, particularly PostgreSQL with PostGIS.

- Experience with AI/ML in a geospatial context, including familiarity with machine learning algorithms and data preprocessing techniques.

- Excellent multitasking abilities, capable of leading training programs, conducting R&D, and developing software simultaneously.

What We Offer:

- A cutting-edge role at the intersection of technology, environment, and conservation.

- Opportunities for professional growth in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team.

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

How to Apply:

Please send your resume, cover letter, and any relevant project samples or portfolios demonstrating your expertise in GIS development, AI/ML applications, and training experience to vijay@agsrt.com

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Engineer


**Category:** Digital & IT
**Location:**Bangalore, Karnataka, IN  

**Department:** Global Security Operations (GSO)  


At Novo Nordisk, we strive to be at the forefront of digital healthcare and to succeed with this, we need many bright minds. Working directly or indirectly with all parts of Novo Nordisk Globally, you will play a significant part in leading Novo Nordisk towards the future of digital healthcare securely. Do you have what it takes to succeed in this role? Then, join a growing team, working in an international environment. **Apply now**!  


**About the department**
Global Information Security, GBS is an area within Digital Data and IT GBS. Global Information Security, GBS is an integral part of Global Information Security Organisation of Novo Nordisk which is headed by the CISO (Chief Information Security Officer) and consists of two main areas: Global Security Operations (GSO) and Global Information Security Advisory (GISA). In GIS (Global Information Security) GBS (Global Business service), we work closely with Global Information Security organisation in defining and executing on strategy to support the digital journey of Novo Nordisk by ensuring smooth operations of SOC, Service Management, advisory support, Security Mailbox, and various other Information Security functions.  


**The Position**
As a Security Specialist you will be anchored to and support the Global Security Operations mission with Global Information Security. It includes,
* Building and maintaining interfaces between enterprise applications, infrastructure, and security systems. Examples include ServiceNow, Splunk, Sentinel, Qlik, PowerBI, AWS, Azure, Anomali, Cribl, Trellix, and Tenable products and delivering Data analytics, detections, and automation through SIEM/SOAR content development (Alerts and Signatures) and maintenance.
* Gathering and tracking stakeholder requirements and applying fundamental knowledge of Cloud IAAS/SAAS/PAAS platforms to deliver solutions for data collection and analysis and record, track, and maintain their work items within a work management system such as Azure DevOps.
* Quickly learning the basics of new security platforms and discovering how to integrate with new data sources to configure, gather, and tune security alerts and events from diverse services and softwar and documenting their work and commenting code sufficiently to communicate critical details for others to pick up the work and develop further if required.
* Metrics and reporting through maintenance of data connections, data warehousing, and reporting within BI Platforms.
* Working independently with minimal guidance and oversight and is adept and finding solutions that often arise through the course of development and operations.

  


**Qualification**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, cyber security, engineering, or other relevant fields.
* 6-8 years’ experience within IT and relevant 4+years development experience as a primary responsibility.
* Preference will be given to individuals experienced with JavaScript and Python.
* Experience on SIEM/SOAR platforms is preferred
* Fundamental knowledge of and experience working with Information Security is preferred.
* Foundational Knowledge of Major operating systems in general, and experience developing and operating in Linux operating systems is a must.
* Experience in Qlik Sense or Power BI and Azure or AWS is preferred.
* Experience with source code version control systems and API integrations is required.
* Experience with common platforms such as Office 365, ServiceNow, Azure DevOps is highly preferred.
* Experience administering and building complex queries and working in an enterprise scale IT operations environment highly preferred.
* Excellent communication in English and stakeholder management skills.

  


**Working at Novo Nordisk**
We are a proud life-science company, and life is our reason to exist. We’re inspired by life in all its forms and shapes, ups and downs, opportunities, and challenges. For employees at Novo Nordisk, life means many things – from the building blocks of life that form the basis of ground-breaking scientific research, to our rich personal lives that motivate and energies us to perform our best at work. Ultimately, life is why we’re all here - to ensure that people can lead a life independent of chronic disease.  


**Contact**
To submit your application, please upload your CV online (click on Apply and follow the instructions).  


**Deadline**
12- March- 2024

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  


At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

title: GIS Specialist
description:
We are seeking a skilled GIS Specialist with 1 to 2 years of experience to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and possess expertise in managing GIS servers such as GeoServer, ArcGIS Server, or similar open-source solutions. Additionally, proficiency in geospatial services, coordinate systems, and related technologies is required. The GIS Specialist will play a key role in managing and optimizing our geospatial infrastructure to support various projects and initiatives.

Responsibilities:

Manage and administer GIS servers such as GeoServer, ArcGIS Server, or similar open-source solutions, including installation, configuration, and optimization for performance. Develop and maintain geospatial services, such as web mapping applications, geocoding services, and spatial analysis tools, leveraging capabilities provided by GIS servers. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design geospatial solutions to meet business needs, ensuring compatibility with GIS server technologies. Implement and maintain coordinate systems and projections within GIS server environments to ensure accurate spatial data analysis and visualization. Conduct data quality assessments and perform data cleaning and validation tasks within GIS server environments as needed. Assist in the creation and maintenance of geospatial datasets, including digitizing, editing, and updating spatial data layers within GIS server environments. Provide technical support and training to end-users on GIS server software, tools, and best practices. Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in the GIS field, particularly related to GIS server technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance geospatial capabilities. Document workflows, procedures, and technical specifications related to GIS server administration and geospatial services to ensure knowledge sharing and maintain system documentation. Contribute to the development of GIS standards, policies, and procedures to ensure consistency and efficiency across projects, with a focus on GIS server environments. Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Geography, Geomatics, GIS, Computer Science, or related field. 1 to 2 years of professional experience in GIS, with a focus on GIS server management and geospatial services. Proficiency in managing GIS servers such as GeoServer, ArcGIS Server, or similar open-source solutions, including installation, configuration, and troubleshooting. Strong understanding of coordinate systems, projections, and spatial reference systems. Hands-on experience with GIS software such as ArcGIS, QGIS, or OpenLayers, with a focus on integrating these tools with GIS server environments. Knowledge of web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and frameworks (Leaflet, OpenLayers) for building web mapping applications integrated with GIS servers. Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, PostGIS) and SQL for spatial data management within GIS server environments. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions within GIS server environments. Effective communication skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality results within established timelines. Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with cloud-based GIS platforms (e.g., ArcGIS Online, Google Maps Platform) and their integration with GIS server technologies. Knowledge of spatial analysis techniques and tools for spatial data processing within GIS server environments. Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) for managing geospatial code and configurations within GIS server environments. Familiarity with geospatial data formats and standards (e.g., GeoJSON, Shapefile, OGC standards) within GIS server environments. Certifications in GIS or related fields (e.g., Esri Technical Certification, GISP) would be a plus. This is an exciting opportunity for a motivated GIS professional to contribute to our organization's success by leveraging their expertise in managing GIS servers and geospatial services. If you are passionate about GIS and enjoy working in a dynamic and collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this position.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.


The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!


Primary Purpose of Job:


Stantec is a leader in global infrastructure, water resource development, Buildings, Mining, Oil and Gas providing engineering design and remediation, construction, procurement, program management, and technology solutions for the environmental, water, wastewater, energy and power markets of the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific region. Stantec is looking for GIS Specialist with expertise in Water/Environment/Roads/Civil applications to be based in the Pune, India office.


The GIS Analyst role involves supporting the various Stantec offices globally for different projects include Database Management, Remote Sensing, Satellite Image Processing, Geospatial Analysis using ArcGIS Desktop and ArcGIS Pro, publishing, and hosting services on ArcGIS Online/Portal for ArcGIS (ArcGIS Server). Working knowledge of Web Apps like Arc Collector, Survey123, Workforce etc.


Key Accountabilities:


* Understanding the client’s needs and transform the available data into geo-spatial format.
* Analyze satellite images and carry the Landuse/Landcover mapping, Supervised/Unsupervised classification using image processing software packages like eCognition, ArcGIS Pro, etc.
* Design the data model based on existing survey proforma(s) and could be able to prepare Geodatabase/Datasets/Feature Classes along with required domain/subtypes/dropdown lists/Relationship Classes/Attachments etc. which will be used to publish using ArcGIS Desktop/ArcGIS Pro.

title: Cfd Modeller
description:
WSP is seeking an Environmental Modeller with experience of Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) to join our large and growing Environmental technical team in Noida/Bengaluru to work with our UK wide national air quality team.

  

The successful applicant will operate within a team of environmental professionals in India and will be part of WSP UK’s Earth & Environment business, delivering the highest standards of technical work and aiding the continued success of the air quality team by being an integral part of our client focused delivery of projects.

  



The work will comprise undertaking CFD modelling to support current air quality projects and potential future projects in built environment within the UK, where more detailed modelling/analysis is required. There will also be opportunities for the applicant to develop their consultancy skills, providing input to technical reports and the costing and writing of proposals and other more complex tasks. There would also be opportunities to undertake air quality modelling using detailed dispersion models such as ADMS, ADMS Roads and AirViro, with training provided (where necessary).

  



You will be joining a well-respected, large and dynamic team with a wide range of clients across different markets and sectors including national and local government, industrial, commercial and scientific sectors.


Responsibilities


The successful applicant would be responsible for many of the following:

* Handling, sorting and preparation of data by managing, interpreting and manipulating large data sets
* Undertaking analysis of survey data
* Screening traffic data supplied in an Excel or GIS format against criteria to determine the inputs to air quality modelling
* Calculating emissions from traffic data
* Preparing data inputs for modelling (using CFD or a detailed dispersion model), running the models and processing the modelling results
* Using the modelling results to assess compliance with relevant Air Quality Objectives and to determine appropriate mitigation measures to be applied, where required
* Actively promoting knowledge sharing with an inclusive nature, developing working relations with all aspects of WSP, gaining internal clients along the way
* Generation of figures for inclusion in publications and/or public consultations
* Supporting more senior colleagues with ad-hoc project tasks

  

Key Competencies / Skills


Essential Skills


We did love to hear from you if you have these essential skills:

* Have an appropriate academic qualification in an environmental, scientific, engineering or related discipline
* Have at least 3 years’ experience in Environmental Consultancy, ideally with air quality experience/experience within the built environment
* Working knowledge of full CFD simulation workflow – geometry cleanup, meshing, setting boundary conditions, running simulation and post-processing
* Experience of using CFD software especially OpenFOAM
* Familiarity with Rhino, Autodesk /Sketchup or similar CAD packages
* Good understanding of concepts of fluid dynamics, heat transfer and radiation
* Knowledge of one or more of the following:, Linux, ParaView, Python
* Strong skills in programming including C++, Python and Bash in Linux.
* Have experience of handling and managing data sets for analysis with strong Excel data analysis skills
* Are skilled and experienced in statistical and spatial data analysis
* Are experienced at using ArcMap GIS software or QGIS
* Are ambitious and appreciate the responsibilities associated with undertaking work in highly technical subject areas
* Have strong communication skills to include fluent written and verbal English with report writing skills such as experience of Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) chapter writing
* Are familiar with sources of air pollution and air quality issues
* Have good collaborative working skills requiring the ability to explain complex processes and highly technical subject matters in a way that is logical and understandable – using plain English and experience of interfacing with other disciplines
* Are a good team worker with excellent and demonstrable attention to detail
* Are confident and highly motivated, with good and proactive communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
* Are able to demonstrate a pragmatic and proactive approach to project work, whilst delivering technical expertise and working closely with fellow professionals
* Are willing to help support, mentor and develop other team members, as we build a team we would like our experienced hire to mentor and train new team members

  

Desirable Skills

* Knowledge of the UK planning and permitting process in the relation the regulation of air quality
* Experience working for a Global Environmental Consultancy
* Are familiar with specialist modelling software such as for air quality ADMS, ADMS Urban, ADMS Roads, AirViro and CALPUFF
* Knowledge of UK Air Quality legislation and guidance such as the Design Manual for Roads and Bridges would be beneficial
* Knowledge of air pollution chemistry
* Project management experience

title: CAD Technician
description:
Position: AutoCAD Specialist for Land Acquisition and Solar/Wind Farm Development

Company: One of our Clients

Location: Bap, Jodhpur (Rajasthan)

Salary: Best in Industry

Email CVs @ : iconicpersonnel@gmail.com

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced AutoCAD Specialist to join our team in the land acquisition and development phase of solar and wind farm projects. The ideal candidate will have expertise in AutoCAD software, particularly in drafting and designing land layouts, site plans, and infrastructure development for renewable energy projects. This role will involve collaborating with engineers, surveyors, environmental specialists and project managers to ensure the efficient and accurate creation of plans and drawings necessary for land acquisition and development processes.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Utilize AutoCAD software to create detailed drawings, site plans, and layouts for solar and wind farm projects.

2. Collaborate with engineers and other team members to interpret technical specifications and project requirements into accurate designs and plans.

6. Coordinate with external consultants, contractors, and stakeholders to incorporate feedback and revisions into drawings and plans.

8. Maintain accurate records and documentation of all drawings and revisions.

Qualifications:

1. Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Environmental Engineering, Architecture, or related field.

2. Proficiency in AutoCAD software with a minimum of 3-5 years of experience in drafting and design.

3. Strong understanding of land development processes, including zoning regulations, land use planning, and environmental considerations.

4. Experience working on renewable energy projects, particularly solar and wind farms, is desirable.

5. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams.

6. Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality in all work.

7. Familiarity with GIS software and other design tools is a plus.

title: Digital Transformation Consultant
description:
Job requisition ID :: 64588
Date: Feb 23, 2024
Location: Bhubaneshwar-CEC
Designation: Consultant
Entity: Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu India LLP
**What impact will you make?**

  


Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration, and high performance. As the undisputed leader in professional services, Deloitte is where you’ll find unrivaled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

  


**The Team**  



As a member of the Operations Transformations team you will embark on an exciting and fulfilling journey with a group of intelligent and innovative globally aware individuals. The team essentially consists of specialists and Subject Matter Experts in Infrastructure Sectors like Transportation & Logistic (Aviation, Railways, Ports & Integrated Logistics), Energy And Resources, Industrial Infrastructure, Roads & Highways, Urban Transport, Water Supply & Sanitation, etc. , government policies, regulations and governance; public service delivery such as public health, education and skill development. Infrastructure practice supports and works with various ministries and departments at the Central & State Government levels. Our clients include infrastructure players, private equity players, government bodies, public sector organizations, and various multilateral and bilateral agencies.

  


Our professional services span a broad range including assisting clients in development of sector strategies and policies, market entry strategies, financial / commercial financial viability assessment, project formulation, feasibility assessments, governance and administrative reforms, institutional strengthening, capacity development, organization restructuring, reforms and restructuring, regulatory & policy reviews, accounting and financial management, fiscal analysis, e-governance projects, technology enabled public service delivery, socio-economic assessment, monitoring and evaluation, impact/outcome assessments for Public Private Partnerships, etc.

  


Deloitte brings an in-depth understanding of infrastructure projects and public sector at all levels-national, state, district, and local levels-gained through years of consistent service to this critical segment of our economy. It is this understanding that allows us to develop advanced thought leadership and contribute as a strategic partner in development initiatives for infrastructure sectors both in the public and private space as well as for public sector in general.

  


**Roles and Responsibilities**


**Job type: Full time contract**


**Contract period: 2 yrs (extendable)**


**Job location: Bhubaneshwar**


1 Procurement Expert:  

a) Graduate in any discipline and MBA / PGDBM in finance with atleast 10 years of total experience.

PMU in Central / State Govt PSUs / Agencies in the field of procurement.  

c) He / She shall have experience in procurement of goods, works & services in Government  

sector.


2. GIS Expert  

a) Graduation in Geography and PG Diploma / Masters in remote sensing / GIS, having total  

relevant experience of 6 years.  

b) Experience in Geographic Information Systemapplication in Urban planning, Smart City  

Projects, Area Based Development Plans, Regional Plan, Sub-Regional Plan, Master plan, Village Development Plan, Zonal Plan and Regional Plan.

  


**How you’ll grow**

  


At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help build world-class skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development.


Programs at Deloitte University, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.


Explore Deloitte University, The Leadership Centre.

  


**Benefits**


At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.


Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.

  


**Our purpose**

Deloitte is led by a purpose: *To make an impact that matters*.

  

Every day, Deloitte people are making a real impact in the places they live and work. We pride ourselves on doing not only what is good for clients, but also what is good for our people and the communities in which we live and work—always striving to be an organization that is held up as a role model of quality, integrity, and positive change.


Learn more about Deloitte's impact on the world

  


**Recruiter tips**


We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to.

title: GIS Specialist
description:
Position: GIS Remote Sensing Specialist

Welcome to AyyanRCM Private Limited..

We are having immediate openings for the position of GIS Remote Sensing Specialist.

Experience Minimum 2 years

Job Summary:

We are seeking a skilled GIS Remote Sensing Specialist to join our team and contribute to our geospatial data analysis and mapping projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in GIS, remote sensing, and spatial analysis. The role involves using advanced geospatial technologies to analyze and interpret satellite imagery, aerial photographs, and other remotely sensed data for various applications.

Responsibilities:

* **Data Acquisition and Pre-processing:**
* Acquire and process satellite imagery, aerial photographs, LiDAR, and other remote sensing data.
* Conduct quality assessment and preprocessing of raw data to ensure accuracy and reliability.
* **Spatial Analysis:**
* Perform spatial analysis using GIS tools to extract meaningful information from remote sensing data.
* Conduct land cover classification, change detection, and other spatial analyses.
* **Map Production:**
* Generate accurate and visually appealing maps using GIS software.
* Collaborate with other team members to integrate remote sensing results into broader mapping projects.
* **Modeling and Simulation:**
* Develop and implement geospatial models and simulations to analyze and predict environmental changes.
* Stay updated on the latest advancements in remote sensing technology and apply them to enhance modeling capabilities.
* **Data Integration:**
* Integrate remote sensing data with other geospatial datasets to create comprehensive analyses.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to incorporate remote sensing information into broader research projects.
* **Documentation and Reporting:**
* Document methodologies, workflows, and results for internal and external stakeholders.
* Prepare clear and concise reports and presentations to communicate findings to non-technical audiences.
* **Quality Control:**
* Implement quality control measures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of remote sensing analyses.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data integrity and processing.
* **Collaboration:**
* Collaborate with internal teams, clients, and external partners to understand project requirements and deliver high-quality geospatial solutions.

Requirements:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Geography, Remote Sensing, GIS, Environmental Science, or a related field.
* Proven experience in remote sensing, GIS, and spatial analysis.
* Proficiency in using remote sensing software (e.g., ENVI, ArcGIS, QGIS) and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
* Strong understanding of geospatial concepts and data structures.
* Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
* Effective communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
* Familiarity with various satellite platforms and sensors.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience with machine learning techniques applied to remote sensing data.
* Knowledge of geospatial web technologies.
* Familiarity with industry-specific applications of GIS and remote sensing (e.g., agriculture, forestry, urban planning).

title: Remote Sensing Specialist - Forestry Focus
description:
Job Title: Remote Sensing Specialist - Forestry Focus

Location: Bangalore

Job Type: Full-time

Experience Required: 2-4 years in Advanced Remote Sensing using Erdas Imagine and Envi

About Us:

Our team is at the cutting edge of environmental and forestry conservation, leveraging the most sophisticated remote sensing technology and spatial analysis tools. Our mission is to use advanced remote sensing capabilities to monitor forest ecosystems globally, providing critical data for combating deforestation, enhancing reforestation efforts, and promoting sustainable forest management practices.

Job Description:

We are in search of a highly skilled Remote Sensing Specialist with specialized expertise in Erdas Imagine and Envi software for forestry applications. This role is critical for analyzing complex satellite imagery and aerial data to support our forestry conservation objectives, including monitoring deforestation rates, assessing forest health, and evaluating biodiversity within forested landscapes.

Key Responsibilities:

- Utilize advanced features of Erdas Imagine and Envi for sophisticated remote sensing analysis, including classification algorithms, change detection, and vegetation indexing specifically tailored to forestry.

- Perform high-level spatial analyses using GIS software such as ArcGIS and QGIS, focusing on forest cover, health assessments, and land-use change.

- Interpret complex remote sensing datasets from a variety of sources, including high-resolution satellite images, LIDAR data, and UAV (drone) imagery to support forestry conservation efforts.

- Work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team to integrate remote sensing data with on-the-ground conservation strategies and sustainable forest management practices.

- Stay abreast of the latest advancements in remote sensing technologies and methodologies, with a particular focus on applications in forestry and environmental monitoring.

Skills and Qualifications:

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Forestry, Environmental Science, Geography, Remote Sensing, or related field, with a strong emphasis on remote sensing applications.

- 2-4 years of direct experience in remote sensing, with extensive expertise in Erdas Imagine and Envi, specifically applied to forestry and environmental projects.

- Advanced proficiency in GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS) with a solid foundation in spatial analysis, forestry mapping, and ecological data interpretation.

- Demonstrable experience with various remote sensing datasets and technologies, including satellite imagery, LIDAR, and UAV (drone) imagery, with a focus on forest and environmental applications.

- Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and technical skills, with the ability to manage complex datasets and derive actionable insights.

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to a non-technical audience.

What We Offer:

- A working environment within a team that is passionate about using technology for environmental good.

- The opportunity to work on projects that have a tangible impact on global forest conservation and sustainable management initiatives.

- Continuous professional development in the rapidly evolving field of remote sensing and GIS, with a focus on forestry applications.

- A competitive salary and benefits package, reflecting the importance and impact of your role in our organization.

How to Apply:

To apply, please submit your resume, a detailed cover letter, and a portfolio or examples of previous work that demonstrate your expertise in Erdas Imagine, Envi, and forestry-related remote sensing projects. Highlight your proficiency with advanced remote sensing techniques, GIS analysis, and any relevant forestry conservation projects you have contributed to.

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds with a passion for environmental conservation and advanced remote sensing skills to apply. Join us in our mission to leverage cutting-edge technology for sustainable forest management and conservation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: ₹20,000.00 - ₹50,000.00 per month

* Bangalore, Karnataka: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Remote Sensing & GIS Consultant
company: Fulgro Environmental & engineering Services India Pvt. Ltd.
description:
**Title: Assistant Manager in (Remote Sensing & GIS)**

**Company: Fulgro Environmental & Engineering Services** 

**Location: Jaipur, Rajasthan**

**Type: Full-time**

**Experience: 3-5 Years** 

**Job Description**: We are seeking a talented Remote Sensing **&** GIS Specialist to join our team. As a GIS Specialist, you will play a crucial role in managing and analysing geographic data to support various projects and initiatives within our organization

**Responsibilities:** 

· Utilize GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS) to manage, analyse, and visualize spatial data.

· Process and interpret remote sensing imagery to monitor environmental changes, land cover, and land use patterns.

· Conduct spatial analysis, including spatial statistics, network analysis, and geo processing tasks.

· Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to integrate GIS and remote sensing data into project workflows and decision-making processes.

· Develop customized maps, reports, and presentations to communicate spatial information effectively.

· Stay current with emerging GIS and remote sensing technologies, methodologies, and best practices

**Experience specific to functional area must include:**

· Sound knowledge of GIS and Remote Sensing software's like ArGIS, QGIS, Erdas etc. ii. Experience on Advance / Specialized GIS tools like Spatial Analyst, 3D Analyst, Subsurface Analyst, LIDAR, Network Analyst, like Spatial Analyst, Overlay Analysis

· Experience in GIS database management. iv. Plotting of ground water contours.

· Preparation of water budget for an area.

· Hydro geomorphological analysis/ Stratigraphy/Lithology etc.

· Must be acquainted with state and national policies latest state and national policies, Guidelines/Rules/legislation, Act and Amendments related to water regime and relevant areas.

· Developing geological maps.

· It is also expected that the expert has the following knowledge /experience

· Contribution to Hydrogeology report documentation

· Understanding of policies, guidelines and the legislation related to ground water

**Qualifications:**

· Master's (post-graduate) degree in Science/Technology or equivalent in either subject Geology/Applied Geology/ Geo-informatics/ Water Resources Engineering/Environmental sciences/ Environmental engineering or Equivalent.

· B. E/ B. Tech and above in Civil/ Mining engineering or equivalent with special paper in Remote sensing & GIS or project work done in Remote sensing & GIS from a UGC/AICTE recognized University/ Institution or equivalent. iii. Desirable: PhD in relevant subject.

**Send your resume on: Hr.fulgro@gmail.com**

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: ₹227,898.35 - ₹1,405,689.88 per year

Schedule:

* Day shift

Experience:

* total work: 5 years (Preferred)

* Jhotwara, Jaipur, Rajasthan (Required)

title: Manager
description:
SankalpTaru Foundation is an IT enabled NGO, spreading greenery with its core philosophy of “planting trees for the people, by the people”. Having rooted and survived close to a million trees across 27 states and some of the majorly polluted cities of India, we are constantly escalating healthy-happy smiles through our trees. We are seeking a passionate and dedicated individual to join our team as a Watershed Management Specialist. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in watershed management, combined with expertise in utilizing information technology to support conservation efforts. As a Watershed Management Specialist, you will play a key role in designing and implementing projects aimed at preserving and restoring watersheds in the region.

Job Title: Watershed Management Specialist

Location: Dehradun/ Gurgaon / Pune

Organization: SankalpTaru Foundation

Responsibilities:

* Develop and implement watershed management plans in collaboration with local communities, government agencies, and other stakeholders.
* Conduct field surveys and assessments to identify areas of concern and prioritize conservation efforts.
* Utilize GIS (Geographic Information Systems) and remote sensing technology to analyze land use patterns, hydrology, and other relevant data for effective watershed planning.
* Design and oversee the implementation of soil and water conservation measures, including afforestation, soil erosion control, and water harvesting structures.
* Facilitate capacity-building activities and training workshops for community members on sustainable watershed management practices.
* Monitor and evaluate the impact of watershed management interventions and prepare reports documenting project outcomes and lessons learned.
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams within the organization to integrate IT solutions into watershed management strategies, such as mobile applications for data collection and monitoring.
* Engage in advocacy and outreach activities to raise awareness about the importance of watershed conservation and garner support for our initiatives.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree or higher in Environmental Science, Natural Resource Management, Forestry, Hydrology, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
* At least 2-3 years of professional experience in watershed management or environmental conservation.
* Proficiency in GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS) and remote sensing techniques for spatial analysis and mapping.
* Strong project management skills, including the ability to plan, implement, and evaluate conservation projects effectively.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders.
* Fluency in Hindi and English, both written and verbal, is required. Knowledge of regional languages is a plus.
* Commitment to the mission and values of SankalpTaru Foundation, with a genuine passion for environmental sustainability and community development.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹20,000.00 - ₹25,000.00 per month

Benefits:

* Cell phone reimbursement
* Food provided
* Health insurance
* Internet reimbursement
* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Weekend availability

Supplemental pay types:

* Yearly bonus

Experience:

* total work: 3 years (Required)
* Watershed Management: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Dehradun, Uttarakhand: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Willingness to travel:

* 75% (Required)

Work Location: In person
