title: Technical Trainer
description:
Job Description
Who we are  

  

Do you want to join our Geo-data revolution? Fugro’s global reach and unique know-how will put the world at your fingertips. Our love of exploration and technical expertise help us to provide our clients with invaluable insights. We source and make sense of the most relevant Geo-data for their needs, so they can design, build and operate their assets more safely, sustainably and efficiently. But we’re always looking for new talent to take the next step with us. For bright minds who enjoy meaningful work and want to push our pioneering spirit further. For individuals who can take the initiative, but work well within a team.
Job Profile :
Trainer is responsible to provide technical training to production team and conduct TNI (training need identification) to assess the skill gap. Prepare training materials and learning aids. Conduct surveys and assessment to gauge training effectiveness. Provide support to transition new types of project and create well defined training program.
Roles and Responsibilities* Work closely with the Training Manager to deliver engaging training programs
* Create training programs to address skill gaps in employees.
* Offer tailored learning support to various departments within the organization.
* Evaluate employee performance to gauge where skills are lacking.
* Prepare learning materials for programs.
* Develop onboarding programs for new employees.
* Conduct surveys to gauge the effectiveness of programs.
* Develop comprehensive training materials, including presentations, manuals, and multimedia visual aids, with input from GIS Specialists.


Qualification and Skills* Bachelor’s degree preferably in education or training.
* Prior experience as a trainer or a similar position.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Willing to learn GIS industry tools and software like ArcGIS, MicroStation, Terra etc.
* Ability to identify gaps in skills.
* Knowledge of various teaching methods and approaches.
* Proficient in using multimedia and e-learning tools.
* Excellent organizational skills.


HSE Responsibilities:
Responsible for ensuring safety of self and others at site. Prevent damage of equipment and assets Responsible for following all safety signs/procedures/ safe working practices Responsible for using appropriate PPE’s Responsible for participating in mock drills. Entitled to refuse any to undertake any activity considered unsafe. Responsible for filling up of hazard observation card, wherever hazard has been noticed at site. Responsible for safe housekeeping of his work place. To stop any operation that is deemed unsafe To be able to operate fire extinguisher in case of fire To report an incident as soon as possible to immediate supervisor and HSE manager To complete HSE trainings as instructed to do so.
Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:
Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated.

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
**Senior Data Architect**

RMSI Cropalytics is looking a Senior Data Architect to join our software team.

As a Senior Data Architect, you will analyse large amounts of business data, solve real world problems, and develop metrics and business cases that will enable us to continually delight our customers worldwide. You will also work with a team of Software Architects and Engineers, Data Producers (GIS, Others) to perform, automate and scale the data scraping, manipulating, cleansing, analysis, and to make the data more actionable to feed ML models and manage business at scale. We are working with a range of specialist vendors to accelerate our development cycle and you will play an active role in retaining the platform intelligence in house for future and further development.

In addition, use will implement Cloud SQL, No-SQL, BLOB, Caches DB stores architecture and LLD, Data Engineering, BI and Data Engineering pipeline architecture, design and development for security, performance and scalability + existing RMSI identified staff training commensurate to area of expertise

This role will develop as the new venture takes shape and therefore its specification will be reviewed regularly and modified, if required, in accordance with the needs of the future business requirements.

**Mandatory Technical Skills**

· You will architect and do the LLD design of secure, performant and scalable software products

· You will own many large datasets, implement new data pipelines that feed into or from critical data systems

· Successful candidates will bring strong technical abilities combined with a passion for delivering results for customers, internal and external

· This role requires a high degree of ownership and a drive to solve some of the most challenging data and analytic problems

· Candidates must have demonstrated ability to manage large-scale data modelling projects, identify requirements and tools, build data warehousing solutions that are explainable and scalable

· In addition to the technical skills, the successful candidate will possess a high intellectual curiosity with the ability to learn new concepts/frameworks and technology rapidly as changes arise

· Assess database implementation procedures to ensure they comply with internal and external regulations.

· Monitoring and troubleshoot database performance and scalability issues

· Manage production, QA, Staging and development database environments.

**Requirements:**

· MCA/B.Tech/M.Tech in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field

· Proven experience of 12-18 years commensurate to this job requirement

· Hands-on experience in Postgres, including the geospatial aspect of the database

· Must have hands-on coding experience in Python, shell scripting

· Experience architecting a large-scale production database platform

· Experience working on Public Cloud like AWS, Azure developer tooling commensurate to this job requirement

· 3 years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, data science, or related field with experience in manipulating, processing, and extracting value from datasets

· Understanding of Big Data technologies and solutions (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce, Spark, EMR) and multiple scripting and languages (YAML, Python, JSON, SQL)

· Understanding of AWS managed services in the big data and data warehousing category

· 5+ years of industry experience in software development, data engineering, business intelligence, data science, or related field with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets

· 5+ years of hands-on experience in writing complex, optimized SQL queries and coding in scripting languages like Python, Shell Scripting, etc.

· Experience using business intelligence reporting tools (MS Power BI, Tableau, AWS QuickSight)

· Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles

· Build robust and scalable data pipelines using a range of tools and programming languages.

· Knowledge of distributed systems as it pertains to data storage and computing

· Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment

· Ability to combine business intuition with the application of advanced solutions

· A passion for keeping up with the latest in Data Science and Machine Learning communities

· A curious mind, self-starter and endlessly keen to learn and develop themselves professionally

**Behavioural Skills:**

· Strong analytical skill, innovative and ability to think creatively, problem solving approach, leadership and motivational skills

· High attention to detail, ability to learn new technology, positive attitude

· Self-driven, knowledge on quality concepts & result oriented

· Excellent communication and presentation skills

· Strategic vision and decision-making skills

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Provident Fund

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:

* Performance bonus

Experience:

* total work: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Noida, Uttar Pradesh (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Noida, Uttar Pradesh: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Environmental Technician
description:
Role:


Support the design team in the delivery of Landscape project design information utilising BIM at all project stages. Assist with the production of drawing material, maps and 3D modelling. Assist the project team with the production of information to coordinate specialist disciplines information and help to identify areas where potential issues may arise. Have a good understanding of UK building standards to implement in the design. The Architectural Technician will report to the Senior Technician or Project Landscape Architect.


Job Responsibilities:

* Collate and organise technical design information relevant to the specific project.
* Prepare design information in a BIM environment utilising Autodesk Revit or Civils 3D.
* Understand technical construction requirements to inform the production of design information.
* Identify potential design issues and come up with solutions to mitigate.
* Monitor design information for potential health and safety risks and contribute to risk identification and assessment reviews.
* Coordinate design information with other specialist disciplines.
* Have a good understanding of statutory requirements for compliance.
* Contribute to meetings and document preparation to present proposals.


People Management:

* Able to manage graduates and provide guidance and support where necessary.
* Follow company values and exhibit appropriate behaviours.
* Manage time efficiently and assist / input into team meetings to review design programme.


Business & Financial

* Support the Project Lead in developing the project execution plan, including financial planning, and forecasting resource.


Softwares Required:

* Revit (Priority)
* AutoCAD
* GIS (Priority)
* Civils 3D (Optional)
* BIM 360
* Projectwise
* Any additional softwares is a benefit

title: GIS Developer
description:
The Company
India's marquee global technology & consulting company. They are an international flag-bearer of technical and managerial excellence. With offices around the globe, the company has a comprehensive presence across multiple segments of the technology product and service industries as well as a blue-chip roster of clients for their Consulting engagements. They are a respected career company and a long-term wealth creator.


The Job
This is a technical role for those who have a passion for data and a zeal to unlock and use data and analytics to inform better business decisions.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Adhering to the Geospatial standards for internal/external data and the risk of incorporating this data onto maps and data repositories. Promoting naming conventions, industry standard acronyms, codes, units of measure & symbols. Recognizing, fixing errors & inconsistences in data and fundamental workflows while managing implications of moving data and maps for avoiding data connection issues in the management of Geospatial Data.
* The structure of various Geospatial data formats (shape file, geodatabase, raster, tabular, tin, etc.), and how to edit data in SDE Geodatabases. Know how and when to apply datum transformations, recognize, trouble-shoot and repair coordinate reference systems issues in existing datasets and how to determine which geodetic parameters were likely used for historic datasets
* Import/export of data between ArcGIS and other applications, including using FME and related tools. Developing tools for data import/export of geospatial data where needed, being cognizant of the tools that already exist.
* You have some familiarity with data-related technologies/languages (e.g. FME, Python, R, ElasticSearch, JavaScript, etc.).
* Reading & modify the display properties of raster data sets for basic analysis. Performing spatial analysis with vector/raster data, including generating surfaces from point data, calculating isopachs and drawing contours.

Your Profile
We are looking out for a Geospatial Specialist to provide technical GIS information and data management analytics and visualization support to our Integrated Energy customer. You will work closely with the various digital portfolio teams to provide specialist expertise and data management, analytics, visualization solutions across a wide range of business domains including Operations, Projects, Crisis, Renewables, Refining and Retail.·


* **Strong experience in SQL, Python and Cloud (Azure preferred)**
* **Strong experience in Fundamentals of Data Structures, Programming is mandatory**
* The concept of spatial analysis, and what the software is capable of. Running simple analysis tools, creating basic models to automate simple workflows moving toward advanced models to automate complex geoscience workflows, basic scripting languages for editing attributes, writing short scripts for data manipulation and data QC.
* Actively seeking to improve data insights, automate and simplify workflows and processes
* Creating innovative solutions to improve process, workflow, best practice and service delivery
* Challenging conventional thinking, problem solving and innovating
* Identifying, piloting and applying new data management techniques to improve data and service delivery
* Actively seeking to apply data science techniques; automation and machine learning, including the use of analytical and visualization tools to translate data and interpreted results into actionable insights and value.
* Actively communicating and promoting the purpose and benefits of information and data management and data analytics, engaging and effectively managing stakeholders.

title: Air Quality Engineer
description:
Role Summary


WSP is seeking an Air Quality Consultant to join our large and growing Environmental technical team in Noida to work with our UK wide national air quality team.

  

The successful applicant will operate within a team of environmental professionals in Noida and will be part of WSP UK’s Strategic Advisory business, delivering the highest standards of technical work and aiding the continued success of the air quality team by being an integral part of our client focused delivery of projects.

  

The work will initially have a data handling focus, including GIS deliverables and data analysis of raw survey information gathered by air quality consultants within the UK. There will also be opportunities for the applicant to develop their consultancy skills and undertake air quality modelling, providing input to technical reports and the costing and writing of proposals and other more complex tasks.


You will be joining a well-respected, large and dynamic team with a wide range of clients across different markets and sectors including national and local government, industrial, commercial and scientific sectors.


Responsibilities


The successful applicant would be responsible for many of the following:

* Handling, sorting and preparation of data by managing, interpreting and manipulating large data sets
* Screening traffic data supplied in an Excel or GIS format against criteria to determine the inputs to air quality modelling
* Running excel based tools to calculate emissions from traffic data
* Preparing data inputs for modelling and processing the results from such modelling
* Undertaking analysis of survey data
* Actively promoting knowledge sharing with an inclusive nature, developing working relations with all aspects of WSP, gaining internal clients along the way
* Generation of figures for inclusion in publications and/or public consultations
* Preparation of material supporting marketing and bidding
* Supporting more senior colleagues with ad-hoc project tasks


Key Competencies / Skills


Essential Skills


We did love to hear from you if you have these essential skills:

* Have an appropriate academic qualification in an environmental, scientific, engineering or related discipline
* Have at least 4 years’ experience in Environmental Consultancy, ideally with air quality experience. We would also consider applicants with mathematical/analyst backgrounds who have experience within consultancy and who have demonstrated a keen interest for the environmental sector
* Are ambitious and appreciate the responsibilities associated with undertaking work in highly technical subject areas
* Have strong communication skills to include fluent written and verbal English with report writing skills such as experience of Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) chapter writing
* Experience of AQ assessment in relation to mining and/or carbon capture and/or windfarms (Priority)
* Good working experience with CALPUFF (Priority)
* Are familiar with sources of air pollution and air quality issues
* Have experience of handling and managing data sets for analysis with strong Excel data analysis skills
* Are skilled and experienced in statistical and spatial data analysis
* Are experienced at using ArcMap GIS software or QGIS
* Have good collaborative working skills requiring the ability to explain complex processes and highly technical subject matters in a way that is logical and understandable – using plain English and experience of interfacing with other disciplines
* Are a good team worker with excellent and demonstrable attention to detail
* Are confident and highly motivated, with good and proactive communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
* Are able to demonstrate a pragmatic and proactive approach to project work, whilst delivering technical expertise and working closely with fellow professionals
* Desirable Skills
* Knowledge of the UK planning and permitting process in the relation to the regulation of air quality
* Experience working for a Global Environmental Consultancy
* Are familiar with specialist air quality modelling software such ADMS, ADMS Urban, ADMS Roads, AirViro
* Knowledge of air pollution chemistry

* Have strong communication skills to include fluent written and verbal English with report writing skills such as experience of Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) chapter writing
* Experience of AQ assessment in relation to mining and/or carbon capture and/or windfarms (Priority)
* Good working experience with CALPUFF (Priority)
* Are familiar with sources of air pollution and air quality issues
* Have experience of handling and managing data sets for analysis with strong Excel data analysis skills
* Are skilled and experienced in statistical and spatial data analysis
* Are experienced at using ArcMap GIS software or QGIS
* Have good collaborative working skills requiring the ability to explain complex processes and highly technical subject matters in a way that is logical and understandable – using plain English and experience of interfacing with other disciplines
* Are a good team worker with excellent and demonstrable attention to detail
* Are confident and highly motivated, with good and proactive communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
* Are able to demonstrate a pragmatic and proactive approach to project work, whilst delivering technical expertise and working closely with fellow professionals
* Desirable Skills
* Knowledge of the UK planning and permitting process in the relation to the regulation of air quality
* Experience working for a Global Environmental Consultancy
* Are familiar with specialist air quality modelling software such ADMS, ADMS Urban, ADMS Roads, AirViro
* Knowledge of air pollution chemistry

title: Air Quality Engineer
description:
Role Summary


WSP is seeking an Assistant Air Quality Consultant to join our large and growing Environmental technical team in Noida to work with our UK wide national air quality team.


The successful applicant will operate within a team of environmental professionals in Noida and will be part of WSP UK’s Strategic Advisory business, delivering the highest standards of technical work and aiding the continued success of the air quality team by being an integral part of our client focused delivery of projects.


The work will initially have a data handling focus, including GIS deliverables and data analysis of raw survey information gathered by air quality consultants within the UK. There will also be opportunities for the applicant to develop their consultancy skills and undertake air quality modelling, providing input to technical reports and the costing and writing of proposals and other more complex tasks.


You will be joining a well-respected, large and dynamic team with a wide range of clients across different markets and sectors including national and local government, industrial, commercial and scientific sectors.


Responsibilities


The successful applicant would be responsible for many of the following:

* Handling, sorting and preparation of data by managing, interpreting and manipulating large data sets
* Screening traffic data supplied in an Excel or GIS format against criteria to determine the inputs to air quality modelling
* Running excel based tools to calculate emissions from traffic data
* Preparing data inputs for modelling and processing the results from such modelling
* Undertaking analysis of survey data
* Actively promoting knowledge sharing with an inclusive nature, developing working relations with all aspects of WSP, gaining internal clients along the way
* Generation of figures for inclusion in publications and/or public consultations
* Preparation of material supporting marketing and bidding
* Supporting more senior colleagues with ad-hoc project tasks
* Key Competencies / Skills


Essential Skills


We did love to hear from you if you have these essential skills:
* Have an appropriate academic qualification in an environmental, scientific, engineering or related discipline
* Have at least 2 years’ experience in Environmental Consultancy, ideally with air quality experience. We would also consider applicants with mathematical/analyst backgrounds who have experience within consultancy and who have demonstrated a keen interest for the environmental sector
* Are ambitious and appreciate the responsibilities associated with undertaking work in highly technical subject areas
* Have strong communication skills to include fluent written and verbal English with report writing skills such as experience of Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) chapter writing
* Experience of AQ assessment in relation to mining and/or carbon capture and/or windfarms (Priority)
* Good working experience with CALPUFF (Priority)
* Are familiar with sources of air pollution and air quality issues
* Have experience of handling and managing data sets for analysis with strong Excel data analysis skills
* Are skilled and experienced in statistical and spatial data analysis
* Are experienced at using ArcMap GIS software or QGIS
* Have good collaborative working skills requiring the ability to explain complex processes and highly technical subject matters in a way that is logical and understandable – using plain English and experience of interfacing with other disciplines
* Are a good team worker with excellent and demonstrable attention to detail
* Are confident and highly motivated, with good and proactive communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team
* Are able to demonstrate a pragmatic and proactive approach to project work, whilst delivering technical
* Desirable Skills
* Knowledge of the UK planning and permitting process in the relation to the regulation of air quality
* Experience working for a Global Environmental Consultancy
* Are familiar with specialist air quality modelling software such ADMS, ADMS Urban, ADMS Roads, AirViro
* Knowledge of air pollution chemistry
* expertise and working closely with fellow professionals

title: Product Specialist
description:
Who we are looking for? Indigo is seeking entrepreneurial individuals with diverse technological backgrounds. We are looking for dedicated, self-motivated professionals who seek technical challenges in a fast paced, quickly expanding, team-oriented environment. Positions are hands-on and involve developing and following complex technical workflows for a variety of GIS and web related tasks for a variety of GIS clients. You must have the technical agility, focus, flexibility, enthusiasm and vision to complement such a work environment.


**Overview:**



Are you a results-oriented professional with experience in software solution marketing? Utilize these skills to *work* with product, industry, and sales managers to develop and implement effective marketing plans and programs that increase sales and awareness of Indigos GeoSpatial Solutions and products.


**Responsibilities:**


* Perform marketing activities for Indigo software products and Solutions including direct marketing, public relations, advertising, social media, and events
* Create and implement marketing plans
* Position and promote Indigos products to prospects, and customers
* Understand user and buyer personas including demographics, business functions, professional motivations, technical knowledge, and company profiles
* Author and edit content for brochures, web pages, case studies, press releases, white papers, seminars, advertisements, demos, sales tool kits, and other marketing collateral
* Participate in the product requirements definition process


**Requirements:**


* Bacheloršs or masteršs in communications, marketing, information management, or other related field
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with the specific ability to understand and convey technical information in a non-technical manner
* A minimum of two years of professional *work* experience with at least one years of experience in product marketing, marketing program management, or consulting
* Strong project management, customer service, and problem-solving skills
* Self-starter, detail- and task-oriented, able to successfully manage multiple priorities and *work* well in a cross-functional team environment


To *apply* for one of our *open* positions, simply send an email to info@indigoinform.com and attach a copy of your resume.

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
JOB REQUISITES


We are looking for an exceptional person to add to our Geotechnical Team in our Bengaluru / Noida, India office. You will have at least 2 to 3 years’ experience in the design of foundations, slope stability, embedded retaining walls, settlement analysis for various infrastructure projects.


The successful candidate will play a key role in the day-to-day delivery of projects working closely with and being supported by other team members, Project Managers and Directors within the UK team.


As a specialist/expert within the UK&I based Geotech Team working predominantly on a range of variety of geotechnical projects across the UK world.


At WSP, you’ll find yourself challenged in fascinating and far-reaching ways. You’ll explore new and inspiring opportunities to make the most of your expertise, broaden your professional horizons and create exciting new possibilities for people, organisations and society in general.


Role Summary


Responsibilities

* Deliver technically competent calculations & reports for review.
* Assist in the management and delivery of project work.
* Provide support in all aspects of project delivery including financial analysis, client liaison, public and statutory body consultation, quality control, management of specialists, contractors and sub consultants.
* Undertake own continuing professional development and provide guidance to graduates.
* Working in accordance with accepted methods and legislation (including CDM) and operate in accordance with WSP’s corporate health & safety, environment, and quality (SHEQ) standards. Taking ownership for aspects of SHEQ management across the geotechnical team.
* Undertake own continuing professional development and showing management of others across a team, to maintain and build professional capability.

Key Competencies


Mandatory Skills

* A sound understanding of geotechnical engineering, with a broad understanding of the underlying principles, and substantial project management experience of medium sized projects.
* Will have proven previous experience of undertaking: geotechnical desk studies; procuring & supervising Ground Investigations (GIs), critical checking of Ground Investigation Factual Reports; preparing Ground Investigation Reports in accordance with the requirements of Eurocode 7 : Part 1.
* Will have contributed to the production of some Geotechnical Design Reports.
* Demonstrable experience of geotechnical design together with a familiarity of design submission documentation. This includes a demonstrable understanding of the underlying principles and a knowledge of Eurocode 7 and UK annex design codes, ground investigation and construction contracts and specifications.
* Ability to use a range of geotechnical software for the design of civil engineering projects including the following: deep and shallow foundations (including pile group analysis); embedded and gravity retaining walls; earthworks/slope stability; reinforced earthworks.
* Proficiency with the use of geotechnical software for the management, review and presentation of ground investigation and geotechnical data using current best practice. Must have the skills to check, critically evaluate and amend your own work, be it drawings, calculations or reports.
* General commercial awareness and an understanding of client requirements as described in contracts, including an understanding and awareness of contractual issues and risks when dealing with clients and sub-consultants.
* Able to support at client facing meetings and able to assist with client/contractor meetings.
* Provides active contribution to technical excellence and innovation across the local geotechnical team.
* Excellent report-writing and strong client liaison skills. Will have significant previous experience of undertaking and managing geotechnical desk studies; designing, procuring & supervising Ground Investigations (GIs); checking and reviewing Ground Investigation Reports & Geotechnical Design Reports in accordance with the requirements of Eurocode 7: Part 1. Client facing and able to lead at client/contractor meetings.
* Good oral communication skills also, able to provide solid support at client facing meetings and able to assist with client/contractor meetings.

title: Senior Developer
description:
**Why Ceinsys**
---------------

Ceinsys is a unique, creative and dynamic place to work. Together, we work, laugh, and brainstorm. Sharing a common goal, we invest in your development, encourage your ideas and reward your efforts. With so many projects and so much to do, chances are that you will be hired for what you love to do. We are an “Equal Opportunity and Equal Pay Employer” and welcome people with diverse backgrounds.


**Unique opportunities**
------------------------


At Ceinsys, we understand that each person is unique, and we develop opportunities to harness this uniqueness. While you may expect to work in the best possible conditions and with some of the most sought-after positions in the industry, we don’t provide cookie-cutter roles and then recruit individuals to fill them. Rather, we are continually innovating and adapting our job descriptions to meet the changing needs of the business.


**We seek. We offer.**
----------------------


Curiosity. Creativity. Team-play. And passion to perform. While our selection process is rigorous and based on the requirements of a highly experienced technical management and staff, you could be certain that you will be mentored at every stage, and we seek team-players with a drive to learn.
  
Senior Developer – Computational Geometry
**Designation :** Computational Geometry

**Location :** Pune

**Experience :** 5 years +

**Qualification :** Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Mathematics, Computational Geometry, or a related field.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Senior Developer or Computational Geometry Specialist with a strong focus on algorithm development.
* Expertise in computational geometry concepts, geometric algorithms and spatial analysis.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C++, Python aya, or similar for algorithm implementation.
* Strong knowledge of data structures, particularly those relevant to computational geometry.
* Experience with geometry libraries and computational geometry frameworks (e.g., CGAL, Shapely, JTS, Opencascade, VTK).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to develop innovative solutions for complex geometric challenges.
* Strong analytical and mathematical skills with an attention to detail.
* Effective communication skills to collaborate with technical and non- technical stakeholders.
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and software development best practices.
* Familiarity with computer graphics, robotics, GIS, or other domains where computational geometry is applied is advantageous.

**Send your CVs to hrdept@ceinsys.com**

title: Geotechnical Engineer
description:
JOB REQUISITES


We are looking for an exceptional person to add to our Geotechnical Team in our Bengaluru / Noida, India office. You will have at least 4 to 5 years of experience in the design of foundations, slope stability, embedded retainigwalls, settlement analysis for various infrastructure projects.


The successful candidate will play a key role in the day-to-day delivery of projects working closely with and being supported by other team members, Project Managers and Directors within the UK team.


As a specialist/expert within the UK&I based Geotech Team working predominantly on a range of variety of geotechnical projects across the UK world.


At WSP, you’ll find yourself challenged in fascinating and far-reaching ways. You’ll explore new and inspiring opportunities to make the most of your expertise, broaden your professional horizons and create exciting new possibilities for people, organisations and society in general.


Role Summary


Responsibilities

* Development of professional and technically competent reports and liaise with the specialists and clients, making use of efficient working practices to provide industry leading, best value services to our clients.
* Provide support in all aspects of project delivery including client liaison, contractors and sub consultants, public and statutory body consultation, quality control, management of specialists.
* Coordinate and manage multidisciplinary teams working on geotechnical projects, work closely with and provide professional advice that builds relationships and raises the profile of the geotechnical division.
* Assist in the delivery of project work with robust project financial management. Has budget responsibility for the delivery of projects and services.
* Working in accordance with accepted methods and legislation (including CDM) and operate in accordance with WSP’s corporate health & safety, environment, and quality (SHEQ) standards.
* Undertake own continuing professional development and that of others, including representing the geotechnical team at technical conferences and seminars.
* Manage, mentor, and develop supporting professional staff.
* Support the pursuit of new business opportunities, both for internal and external clients, assisting business development in line with the business plan. This would include input into, geotechnical bids and proposals.


Key Competencies


Mandatory Skills

* Have technical expertise in geotechnical engineering with a demonstrable understanding of the underlying principles.
* General commercial awareness with an understanding of contractual variances, risks and financial implications of actions.
* Has proven experience of taking responsibility for geotechnical tasks within a competitive business environment, managing both themselves and also the support from others. Contribute to the planning of effective geotechnical resources.
* Able to deliver on geotechnical projects with the minimum of supervision, including preparation of reports to a high technical level. Understands client requirements and reflects this in contract specifications.
* Good report-writing skills. Will have proven previous experience of undertaking and managing: geotechnical desk studies; designing, procuring & supervising Ground Investigations (GIs); writing reports in accordance with the requirements of Eurocode 7 : Part 1.
* Good oral communication skills also, able to provide solid support at client facing meetings and able to assist with client/contractor meetings.
* Demonstrable experience of geotechnical design within a multi-disciplinary environment together with a full understanding of design submission documentation and processes.
* Familiar with and able to interrogate a wide range of geotechnical software for the design of civil engineering projects including deep and shallow foundations (including pile group analysis), embedded and gravity retaining walls, earthworks/slope stability and reinforced earthworks.
* Hands on experience in using geotechnical software like Geoslope, Repute 2.5, WALLAP
* Proficiency with the use of geotechnical software for the management, review and presentation of ground investigation and geotechnical data using current best practice.
* Must have the skills to check others work like drawings, calculations and / or reports.

* Working in accordance with accepted methods and legislation (including CDM) and operate in accordance with WSP’s corporate health & safety, environment, and quality (SHEQ) standards.
* Undertake own continuing professional development and that of others, including representing the geotechnical team at technical conferences and seminars.
* Manage, mentor, and develop supporting professional staff.
* Support the pursuit of new business opportunities, both for internal and external clients, assisting business development in line with the business plan. This would include input into, geotechnical bids and proposals.


Key Competencies


Mandatory Skills

* Have technical expertise in geotechnical engineering with a demonstrable understanding of the underlying principles.
* General commercial awareness with an understanding of contractual variances, risks and financial implications of actions.
* Has proven experience of taking responsibility for geotechnical tasks within a competitive business environment, managing both themselves and also the support from others. Contribute to the planning of effective geotechnical resources.
* Able to deliver on geotechnical projects with the minimum of supervision, including preparation of reports to a high technical level. Understands client requirements and reflects this in contract specifications.
* Good report-writing skills. Will have proven previous experience of undertaking and managing: geotechnical desk studies; designing, procuring & supervising Ground Investigations (GIs); writing reports in accordance with the requirements of Eurocode 7 : Part 1.
* Good oral communication skills also, able to provide solid support at client facing meetings and able to assist with client/contractor meetings.
* Demonstrable experience of geotechnical design within a multi-disciplinary environment together with a full understanding of design submission documentation and processes.
* Familiar with and able to interrogate a wide range of geotechnical software for the design of civil engineering projects including deep and shallow foundations (including pile group analysis), embedded and gravity retaining walls, earthworks/slope stability and reinforced earthworks.
* Hands on experience in using geotechnical software like Geoslope, Repute 2.5, WALLAP
* Proficiency with the use of geotechnical software for the management, review and presentation of ground investigation and geotechnical data using current best practice.
* Must have the skills to check others work like drawings, calculations and / or reports.

title: Technical Manager
description:
Job Description
Who we are?  

Do you want to join our Geo-data revolution? Fugro’s global reach and unique know-how will put the world at your fingertips. Our love of exploration and technical expertise help us to provide our clients with invaluable insights. We source and make sense of the most relevant Geo-data for their needs, so they can design, build and operate their assets more safely, sustainably and efficiently. But we’re always looking for new talent to take the next step with us. For bright minds who enjoy meaningful work and want to push our pioneering spirit further. For individuals who can take the initiative but work well within a team.
Job Responsibilities:
Projects:* Oversee the implementation of project improvements.
* Identify and drive process improvement ideas.
* Identify and suggest best and cost effective software and systems to maximum the utilization and productivity
* Drive simplification and automation initiatives to projects


People:* Lead and manage a team of GIS specialists
* Take ownership of critical escalations and resolve through effective communication
* Collaborate with other internal departments for information and support
* Conduct 1:1 sessions with Specialists for feedback and maximize their potential
* Create a healthy work environment for all, empowering the team with task delegation and ownership
* Enforce health and safety precautions
* Create a positive, collaborative, communicative, innovative, and efficient work culture.


Stakeholder:* Foster strong relationships and effective communication channels with stakeholders at all levels
* Liaise with stakeholders to formulate objectives and understand requirements
* Collaborate with innovation team on technical issues


What we offer
Fugro provides a positive work environment as well as projects that will satisfy the most curious minds. We also offer great opportunities to stretch and develop yourself. By giving you the freedom to grow faster, we think you’ll be able to do what you do best, better. Which should help us to find fresh ways to get to know the earth better. We encourage you to be yourself at Fugro. So bring your energy and enthusiasm, your keen eye and can-do attitude. But bring your questions and opinions too. Because to be the world’s leading Geo-data specialist, we need the strength in depth that comes from a diverse, driven team.  

  

Our view on diversity, equity and inclusion
At Fugro, our people are our superpower. Their variety of viewpoints, experiences, knowledge and talents give us collective strength. Distinctive beliefs and diverse backgrounds are therefore welcome, but discrimination, harassment, inappropriate behaviors and unfair treatment are not. Everybody is to be well-supported and treated fairly. And everyone must be valued and have their voice heard. Crucially, we believe that getting this right brings a sense of belonging, of safety and acceptance, that makes us feel more connected to Fugro’s purpose ‘together create a safe and livable world’ – and to each other.
HSE Responsibilities:
 Responsible for ensuring safety of self and others at site. Prevent damage of equipment and assets Responsible for following all safety signs/procedures/ safe working practices Responsible for using appropriate PPE’s Responsible for participating in mock drills. Entitled to refuse any to undertake any activity considered unsafe. Responsible for filling up of hazard observation card, wherever hazard has been noticed at site. Responsible for safe housekeeping of his workplace. To stop any operation that is deemed unsafe to be able to operate fire extinguisher in case of fire to report an incident as soon as possible to immediate supervisor and HSE manager to complete HSE trainings as instructed to do so.
Disclaimer for recruitment agencies:
Fugro does not accept any unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies. Acquisition to Fugro Recruitment or any Fugro employee is not appreciated.

title: Audio Visual Engineer
description:
What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?
At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.
Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.
Position Summary:
The Senior Audio Visual Engineer (Sr AV Engineer) is a member of the AV Services team of the Global Information Services (GIS) group. The AV Services team is collectively responsible for conferencing services administration: maintaining 550+ global conference rooms, AV design/implementation for real estate refresh and buildout efforts, UC infrastructure associated with AV services, and global Town Hall event management and moderation.
The Sr AV Engineer is responsible for supporting a range of AV and collaboration services, technology, and infrastructure. This role also assists the AV Operations team as needed with meeting and event support tasks.
The ideal candidate will have experience managing Cisco video conferencing infrastructure and endpoints, Microsoft Teams conferencing, and typical conference room collaboration hardware/software solutions.
The ideal candidate will also have excellent technical skills, an understanding of technology’s intersection with Illumina’s business, up to date knowledge of collaboration technologies and trends, and will use this knowledge to continue to drive innovation in the AV collaboration space at Illumina.
Responsibilities:* Performs engineering, operations, and maintenance for key AV platforms and technologies – including but not limited to Cisco Cloud Video Infrastructure, Cisco Video Conference Room Hardware Solutions, Microsoft Teams Conferencing, Microsoft Teams Rooms solutions and Crestron Fusion.
* Ensures the day-to-day availability of AV services for the enterprise
* Plan and manage AV projects, including system installations, upgrades, and integrations, from inception to completion
* Collective responsibility with the rest of the global AV Services team to ensure the Service Management ticket queues are effectively managed based on priority & commitment.
* Communicates to management, managed services partners, and manufacturers outages, priority issues, recurring problems, and patterns.
* Leads the technical investigation and resolution of AV related issues with cross-functional teams when necessary (incident management, problem management and root cause analysis).
* Creation of documentation (knowledge base articles, reference guides, root cause analysis, etc.) related to AV services and technology.
* Drive continuous improvement efforts by identifying areas for optimization, streamlining processes, and implementing best practices.
* Responsible for building standards as well as managing, maintaining, and updating those standards for AV services.
* Performs remote support for meetings, events, & incidents when required in coordination with the AV Operations team.


All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.
Requirements:* At least 5+ years’ experience in the AV industry designing, operating, and maintaining conference room collaboration solutions for video/audio calling, presentation and control systems.
* 5+ years’ experience servicing and supporting Cisco video conferencing infrastructure and collaboration endpoint hardware/software preferred.
* 3+ years’ experience with Microsoft Teams conferencing administration and knowledge of certified Microsoft Teams Rooms solutions preferred.
* Avixa CTS required, CTS-D preferred.
* Cisco CCIE / CCNA / CCNP certifications preferred.
* Microsoft 365 Collaboration Communications Systems Engineer Associate certification desired.
* Excellent communication skills & customer service approach.


All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.
Education:* Bachelors or equivalent Technical associates degree related to audio visual engineering, recording, broadcast solutions or computer science required.

  


Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

title: Project Consultant
description:
Arcadis is the world's leading company delivering sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets.


We are more than 36,000 people, in over 70 countries, dedicated to improving quality of life. Everyone has an important role to play. With the power of many curious minds, together we can solve the world’s most complex challenges and deliver more impact together.


**Role description:**

This role is part of Arcadis’ Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis’ offices globally. The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world. For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as well as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety. Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses. The GEC model is well embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique.


* Providing GIS analysis, spatial data management and map production.
* Delivery of Geographic Information System (GIS) products to meet time quality and budgetary targets.
* Contributing to the ongoing development of GIS processes and providing innovative solutions to align GIS with business outcomes.
* Work with the team for GIS business development
* Providing web –based mapping and development using ESRI technology
* Ensuring quality assurance procedures are implemented and undertaking
* QA verification of calculations and mapping products

The main responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to:


* Working with the Senior GIS Consultant to manage spatial and spatial information in accordance with industry standards
* Ensuring that information management and quality assurance procedure are followed to ensure compliance with Arcadis standards and procedure Production of hardcopy maps and figures to appropriate standards using Arcadis standard templates
* Production of spatial and aspatial data ensuring accuracy and logical consistency in processing and output
* Maintain knowledge of GIS industry practices and software Production of web map Portal and field data collection applications
* Validation and verifications of calculations and mapping products
* Engaging in Continuing Professional Development (CPD)
* Performing other duties and responsibilities as required from time to time by your manager or Arcadis
* Ensuring you are familiar and compliant with Health and Safety regulations and guidelines

**Role accountabilities:**

* Able to work effectively and competently with people at all levels, within and external to the organization.
* Good analytical skills and attention to detail.
* Computer literate; proficient in Windows, MS Word, Excel, and other Microsoft Office applications. Experienced in specialist software packages including ESRI and other GIS technology.
* Models Arcadis Guiding Principles.
* Strong organizational ability to optimize and priorities conflicting demands in a busy environment, achieve deadlines, and see responsibilities through to completion.
* Commercial and a level of maturity needed to understand business needs and drivers.
* Client-centric approach.
* Resilient, comfortable with change and ambiguity.
* Ability to work collaboratively and demonstrates the capability to perform effectively as part of a team across a matrix-type structure
* Good interpersonal and communication skills, including oral and written communication and particularly the ability to present ideas, information, and advice in a way that is understandable by a range of audiences.
* Able to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
* Excellent self-management skills, including working effectively without direct supervision, managing and organizing fluctuating workloads in sometimes stressful situations.
* Results orientated, with a reputation for, and demonstrated achievement of, key strategic priorities.
* Active commitment to continuous personal improvement.
* A team player and considers the views of others.
* Ensures that confidentiality is respected and always maintained.
* High levels of motivation and energy.
* Consistently demonstrates trustworthiness, integrity, professionalism, and honesty.
High emotional intelligence and self-awareness of strengths and potential areas for development  
* 

**Qualifications & Experience:**

Experience, Skills & Knowledge


* Experience with ArcGIS Enterprise or ArcGIS Online and production of
* Story Maps
* Experience in processing drone data in Drone2Map and publishing to
* ArcGIS Enterprise/AGOL
* Experience in creating Web Maps for offline data capture in the field using
* ArcGIS Field Maps, Survey123 and Collector for ArcGIS
* Successful completion of a degree or relevant technical qualification from
* a recognised Tertiary Institution
* Minimum 7 - 10 years’ experience in GIS and excellent understanding of
* ESRI GIS software
* Exposure to CAD technology and techniques preferable
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to identify innovative solutions to problems
* Ability to organise and prioritise oneself
* Ability to work well within a team environment
* Ability to apply GIS processes and technology to tasks arising from
* infrastructure projects in an innovative way

Why Arcadis?


We can only achieve our goals when everyone is empowered to be their best. We believe everyone's contribution matters. It’s why we are pioneering a skills-based approach, where you can harness your unique experience and expertise to carve your career path and maximize the impact we can make together.


You’ll do meaningful work, and no matter what role, you’ll be helping to deliver sustainable solutions for a more prosperous planet. Make your mark, on your career, your colleagues, your clients, your life and the world around you.


Together, we can create a lasting legacy.


Join Arcadis. Create a Legacy.


Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging


We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why equality and inclusion is at the forefront of all our activities. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We are an equal opportunity employer; women, minorities, and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment on any basis including race, caste, creed, colour, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

title: GIS Analyst
description:
Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.


We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.


As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.


The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:  

  

**Position: GIS Analyst**

  

Background  

Gas & Low Carbon Energy are looking for a GIS Analyst to join the Onshore Renewables team within our Technical Center of Excellence. This role will be responsible for optimizing geospatial information system (GIS) and data management activities for onshore renewable energy projects.  

This role will support multi-disciplinary onshore renewables projects varying in size, complexity and technology. These may include onshore wind, solar and energy storage projects either standalone, collocated with green hydrogen production or part of other integrated energy opportunities.  

The GIS Analyst is responsible for the collection, analysis, and visualization of geospatial data, ensuring its accuracy, accessibility, and usefulness to support decision-making processes and project development.
  

  

Expectations  

  

Geospatial Data Management:  

- Collect, validate, and maintain accurate geospatial data, including environmental, topographical, and other relevant datasets.
  

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and in-country regional teams to identify data requirements and establish data collection processes.
  

- Ensure compliance with data quality standards and perform regular data integrity checks.
  

GIS Analysis and Visualization:  

- Utilize GIS software and tools to analyze geospatial data and generate meaningful insights.
  

- Create maps, models, and visualizations to support project planning, site selection, and environmental impact assessments.
  

Database Development and Maintenance:  

- Design, develop, and maintain GIS databases to store and manage geospatial data effectively.
  

- Regularly update and manage geospatial databases, ensuring data integrity and accessibility.
  

- Implement data backup and recovery procedures to prevent data loss or corruption.
  

Collaboration and Teamwork:  

- Collaborate with internal teams, including engineers, environmental specialists, and project managers, to understand their GIS and data needs.
  

- Provide technical expertise and guidance to stakeholders regarding GIS and data-related queries.
  

- Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement within the Technical Center of Excellence.
  

- Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to GIS and data management.
  

Project Support and Documentation:  

- Support project development activities by providing GIS and data management support to various stakeholders.
  

- Assist in the preparation of reports, presentations, and other project-related documents.
  

- Maintain comprehensive documentation of GIS workflows, data sources, and methodologies.
  

  

Qualification:  

- Bachelor's or Master's degree in geography, geomatics, environmental science, or a related field.
  

- Expertise in GIS analysis with a minimum of 5 years in discipline and 2 years with experience in GIS analysis within solar, onshore wind and energy storage technologies.
  

- Proficiency in GIS software, such as ArcGIS, QGIS, or similar tools.
  

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex geospatial data.
  

- Ability to demonstrating beliefs which promote a safe and environmentally responsible work culture, ensuring HSSE risks are considered.
  

  

You Will Work With:  

* Technical Centre of Excellence team including operations, engineering, construction, and technology –collaborating and providing input in discipline
* Project teams in-country, supporting the project lifecycle
* Stakeholders internal and external to the projects
* Cross-functional teams in boarder onshore renewables, Offshore Wind, Hydrogen to ensure standardization, best practice sharing and synergies
* Community of practices across in engineering, procurement, projects.

**Job Type**


Full Time-Regular
**Experience Level**


Mid Level
**Total Years of Exp**


5 - 8

title: Ecologist
description:
**About AiDash**  

AiDash is making critical infrastructure industries climate-resilient and sustainable with satellites and AI. Using our full-stack SaaS solutions, customers in electric, gas, and water utilities, transportation, and construction are transforming asset inspection and maintenance - and complying with biodiversity net gain mandates and carbon capture goals. Our customers deliver ROI in their first year of deployment with reduced costs, improved reliability, and achieved sustainability goals. Learn more at www.aidash.com.
**What we are building?**

We are revolutionizing operations, maintenance and sustainability for core industrial and service sectors. This is what keeps us awake at night. We believe in AI with a purpose; AI with humans at its core, action-oriented Intelligence, solves complex problems, and outperforms the expectations of our customers. **What's the role?**  

Do you love ecology and the power of spatial data? Do you dream of using cutting-edge technology to solve real-world environmental challenges?  

If so, then this geospatial ecologist position is for you! We are looking for a passionate and skilled individuals to join our dynamic team and be part ofAI powered sustainability platform using remote sensing and satellite/ariel imagery. You'll play a pivotal role in mapping detailed habitats, conduct LULC classification, monitoring biodiversity, and informing conservation efforts across diverse landscapes.  


### **What will you do?**

+ **Layer Mapping:**
+ Utilise remote sensing data (satellite imagery, LiDAR, aerial photography, field surveys) and GIS software to map and monitor habitat, biodiversity, and ecosystem health.
+ Design and create intricate habitat maps using GIS software (QGIS, ArcGIS, or similar).
+ Refine map symbology, labelling, and layout for clarity and visual impact.
+ Manage and organise large geospatial datasets effectively.
+ **Land Use/Land Cover (LULC) Classification:**
+ Create and modify LULC classification using remote sensing data to identify and map different land cover types across the UK / EU / USA landscape.
+ Select and apply appropriate classification algorithms and techniques based on data characteristics and project goals.
+ Assess classification accuracy(QA/QC) and uncertainty through validation with ground truth data.
+ Utilise LULC information to understand habitat distribution, landscape patterns, and changes over time.
+ **Geospatial Analysis for Habitats:**
+ Conduct spatial analyses to study habitats (UK / EU / USA or other classification standards) at various scales, utilising satellite imagery, LiDAR, and aerial imagery.
+ Develop and apply advanced habitat mapping techniques tailored to UK / EU / USA ecosystems (heathlands, peatlands, woodlands, coastal environments and others).
+ Analyse habitat change trends and assess the impact of factors like climate change, land-use intensification, and invasive species.
+ Create maps of habitat distribution, biodiversity hotspots, and conservation priorities.
+ **Collaboration and Communication:**
+ Collaborate with field ecologists, data scientists, GIS specialists, and other stakeholders to validate remote sensing data and refine mapping approaches.
+ Stay abreast of ecological concepts, geospatial technology advancements and integrate them into mapping and monitoring strategies.

### **What we are looking for?**

+ Master's or equivalent degree in earth science, ecology, environmental science, geology, botany or other related field with a strong emphasis on ecology, habitat enhancement, biodiversity, geospatial analysis and remote sensing.
+ Prior experience in applying geospatial analysis to ecological mapping or conservation projects is highly desirable.
+ Understanding of habitat mapping, LULC classification, and analysis using remote sensing data, ideally focused on UK/EU ecosystems is preferred.
+ Hands on in GIS software (QGIS, ArcGIS, or similar) and experience remote sensing data and tools.
+ Collaborative and team-oriented with the ability to work independently and in a team.
+ Excellent communication skills to convey complex information effectively.

title: Network Modeler-udm-water
description:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.


The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!


Primary Purpose of Job:


Contribute to the ongoing growth of Stantec ResourceNet Private India Ltd by providing technical expertise in specialist areas of wastewater network modelling. To be involved in the implementation and delivery of leading edge programmes and projects.


Support project managers/team leader by providing technical expertise to ensure that project outcomes in terms of profit, schedule, technical and quality standards, meet both the client and Stantec expectations.


Key Accountabilities:


* Wastewater/stormwater hydraulic modelling


* Model build and verification


* Optioneering & Outline Design of hydraulic solutions


* Development Impact Assessment


* Preparation of technical reports / drawings,


* Working with GIS databases,


* Handling and managing large data sets for analysis


* Carry out other duties as may be assigned from time to time by supervisor/management,


* Need to work off-hours for client co-ordination: Occasionally


* Need to travel off-shore for training/on-site work: Occasionally


Person Specifications:


* bachelor’s/master’s degree in civil/ Environmental Engineering/ Water Resource Engineering


* Understanding of wastewater/stormwater hydraulic modelling, run-off models and hydraulics (gravity & pressure networks)


* Knowledge of hydraulic modelling software, InfoWorks CS, InfoWorks ICM. In addition to this candidate with experience in Mike Urban, TUFLOW, HECRAS 2D and SWMM will be preferred


* Good data manipulation abilities (FME/POWERBI/MS Excel/MS Access database type packages)


* Knowledge of GIS packages: MapInfo, QGIS and ArcGIS preferred.


* Technical report writing skills


* Competent level of client service management, i.e. able to interface with clients and to build and maintain lasting, positive relationships with our Clients


* Capable to analyse, assess, evaluate the issues, complexity pertaining to projects / work packages and support the team lead in mitigating them in advance


* Rigorous attention to detail, able to understand and adopt workflows and commitment to personal professional development


* Competent level of baseline skills, i.e. professional and confident with the essential, basic business and communication skills that are required for career growth in all positions


* Flexible attitude to accepting different work assignments and pro-active attitude to execution / delivery


**Primary Location:** India | Pune

**Employee Status:** Regular


**Job Level:** Nonmanager


**Travel:** No


**Schedule:** Full time

title: Surveyor
description:
**Company Overview:**

People power our future. That is why advancing a dynamic, inclusive environment, where everyone grows and thrives is critically important to us.
  

  

Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing offshore platforms hundreds of miles from shore, and using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  

  

Here, what you do matters.  



  

**Job Overview:**

The Senior Surveyor is responsible for acquiring and processing accurate positioning data (vessel & sensors) during his/her shift (watch). The Senior Surveyor may ensure that positioning data and calibrations are acquired and processed in line with UTEC procedures and to specifications given in the scope of work, and that all results are concisely documented using the relevant UTEC forms. This document specifies the minimum qualifications, core competencies and job-specific key competencies required to fulfill the Senior Surveyor position responsibilities.


This role will be working in offshore vessel.


  

  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Understand and adhere to existing company standard operating procedures covering the following subsection of offshore operations: mobilization, software use and installation, data acquisition, data management, hydrography/oceanography, navigation and positioning and geodesy;
* Use specialized technical software, global and some terrestrial positioning systems, sonars and echo sounders to provide data for the production of nautical charts and maps;
* Work with remotely operated and autonomous underwater vehicles to acquire data in deep oceans;
* Use specialized technical software and geographical information systems (GIS) to manage the integration, processing and presentation of data to clients;
* Prepare reports and results to clients using appropriate formats;
* Provide quality control to data prepared;
* Source information on seabed type, water movements and waves;
* Provide data for oceanographic studies;
* Mentor and provide support to Junior Field Staff;
* Work as team member of technical specialists.
* Adhere strictly to the Company's policies including, but not limited to anti-bribery and Foreign Corrupt Practices;
* Perform other duties or tasks as assigned.
* HSE Responsibilities
	+ Actively participate and lead by example in the Company’s Quality and HSE Systems and Procedures.
	+ Understand and comply with UTEC PPE requirements, policies and procedures.
	+ Be prepared to “Stop the Job” in the event that yourself, others or equipment may be exposed to injury / damage.
	+ Comply with all Health and Safety instructions from UTEC.
	+ Correctly handle all Health and Safety equipment.
	+ Recognise and help control HSE hazards where applicable.
	+ Report all Health, Safety and Environment incidents to management, including near misses, unsafe acts and hazards.
	+ Utilise the Safety Observation Sheet (SOS) reporting system.
	+ Help generate, update and review risk assessments and job safety analysis, where applicable.
	+ Understand emergency plans, alarms and actions required in the event of an emergency.
	+ Participate in relevant HSE meetings and “tool box talks” within respective department.
	+ Demonstrate conversance with the Project HSE Plan where applicable to this position/department.
	+ Participate in accident investigations where required
	+ Assume all employee responsibilities listed in the Workplace Safety and Health Act.
	+ Comply with return-to-work and / or rehabilitation program(s).
	+ Adhere to the ‘UTEC Way 12 Safety and Quality Principles’ at all times
* Principal Working Relationships
	+ UTEC Survey Team (Offshore)
	+ UTEC Project Team (Onshore)
	+ Client Representative
	+ Vessel Crew
	+ 3rd Party Project Personnel (ROV Crew, Inspection Personnel, CP Personnel

  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Degree in Surveying or a Survey related discipline
* 1-2 years of experience
