title: Pipeline Engineer
description:
Job summary


**Entity:**

Production & Operations **Job Family Group:**

Engineering Group **Job Summary:**

bp Technical Solutions India (TSI) center in Pune, aims to build on bp’s existing engineering and technical strengths to deliver high quality services to its hydrocarbons and new energy businesses worldwide! TSI brings together diverse engineering capability to provide technical services across a range of areas including engineering, maintenance, optimization, data processes, projects and subsurface, to deliver safe, affordable, and lower emission energy, while continuously innovating how we work!  

  

About role:  

Provide deep pipeline engineering expertise & judgement in support of engineering risk, integrity management & the delivery of safe, compliant & efficient operations **Job Description:**

**What you will deliver**


The Pipelines team is a small, diverse, team of highly skilled pipeline engineering professionals who work globally supporting bp’s operations in Indonesia, Oman, Azerbaijan, Georgia & Turkey, Egypt, Mauritania & Senegal, UK, Trinidad & the Gulf of Mexico. Every drop of oil, water & condensate & cubic foot of gas produced by bp passes through a pipeline looked after by the team.


The primary responsibility of this role is to be a pipeline engineer in the TSI hub, based in Pune, India.

**There are multiple roles open. The successful candidates will carry out various roles, including:**


Regional Pipeline Field Support: Supporting execution & assessment of subsea inspection campaigns & defining repair requirements.
Subsea & Pipeline Integrity Management support: Working closely with engineers in the regions to manage subsea & pipeline integrity management data in our NEXUS-IC database, the Anomaly Assessment & Tracking system & Inspection Data loading.
Subsea & Pipeline Geospatial, Documentation & Performance Management support: Working closely with engineers in the regions to manage our inspection & engineering data in the GIS (PODS), improve accessibility to our documents in the Electronic Document Management System & build & maintain Power BI dashboards.
**General responsibilities for Pipeline Engineers:**


Elements of the role include risk assessment, integrity management plan development, maintenance, inspection & repair execution engineering support, anomaly assessment, & interaction with major projects
Provides timely updates to Inspection Data Specialist on inspections and repairs scopes and ensures accuracy of the data including QA/QC, timely application of engineered solutions and documentations.
Leading & participating pipeline integrity & improvement activities around the world
Provide pipeline engineering expertise as the Equipment Owner for the pipeline related equipment & System Owner for any transportation systems as assigned by Region.
Region / global pipeline related Domain Expert as assigned by the Pipeline Field Lead support all regions in areas of expertise when requested.
Integrate with associated fields to ensure adequate equipment care, including maintenance & engineering, corrosion, flow assurance, production chemistry, pressure systems integrity, process safety & structural & civil engineering.
Ensure pragmatic solutions are identified to manage risk, production efficiency, defect elimination & standardisation, to deliver safe, reliable & compliant operations.
Own & maintain the documents & data for the assigned equipment.
Own & maintain the risk assessment for the assigned equipment ensuring that the identified threats reflect current operations & use this to define, implement & support delivery of Equipment Strategies by the relevant Execution Owner. Assess anomalies, initiate further actions & follow up to closure.
Prepare, review & endorse pipeline-related metrics (e.g. barrier health, pipeline integrity dashboard & LOPC data) & take action where appropriate.
Pipeline support to incident investigations & the learning process.
Technical management of subsea contractors (e.g. subsea engineering contractors).
**What you will need to be successful**

**Must have education / certifications:**


MSc or MEng is preferred, BEng or BSc or equivalent experience is minimum, or international equivalent in a relevant engineering Discipline.
Professional accreditation, such as Professional Engineer
**Must have experience / skills (to be hired with):**

Technical expertise in several areas related to the discipline applied to Operations. These include risk assessment, risk-based inspection, pipeline engineering assessments, fitness for service, failure investigation, pipeline inspection & monitoring, corrosion, pipeline repair & pipeline geospatial data management.
Proven ability in practical application of engineering standards & practices for pipeline engineering.
People leadership & an ability to network & influence across organisational boundaries.
**Good to have experiences / skills (can be trained for – learning / on the job):**

Support the delivery & maintenance of digital tools to progress continuous improvement of global pipeline support (data gathering & data analysis, equipment dashboards, risk analysis tools, database management, data visualisation).
Experience or knowledge of data visualization software e.g. PowerBI. Citizen developer with knowledge of Python, SQ
 **Travel Requirement**


Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role **Relocation Assistance:**


This role is eligible for relocation within country **Remote Type:**


This position is not available for remote working **Skills:**


Anomaly assessment and management, Defect Elimination, Equipment criticality assessment, Equipment maintenance and inspection strategies, FAT and commissioning, Fatigue Analysis, Fitness for Service, Flanged joint, Integrity Management, Mechanical seals and support systems, Monitoring and data interpretation, Piping, hoses and tubing, Piping vibration, Pressure systems regulatory requirements, Pressure Vessels, Selection and design of pipeline equipment, Stress analysis for integrity and leakage, Valves used for isolation, Wind Turbines **Legal Disclaimer:**


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation related to bp’s recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us to request accommodations.


If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

title: Monitoring Specialist
description:
**ABOUT US**



Wadhwani AI is a nonprofit institute building and deploying applied AI solutions to solve critical issues in public health, agriculture, education, and urban development in underserved communities in the global south. We collaborate with governments, social sector organizations, academic and research institutions, and domain experts to identify real-world problems, and develop practical AI solutions to tackle these issues with the aim of making a substantial positive impact.



We have over 30+ AI projects supported by leading philanthropies such as Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, USAID and Google.org. With a team of over 200 professionals, our expertise encompasses AI/ML research and innovation, software engineering, domain knowledge, design and user research.



In the Press:


* Our Founder Donors are among the Top 100 AI Influencers
* G20 India’s Presidency: AI Healthcare, Agriculture, & Education Solutions Showcased Globally.
* Unlocking the potentials of AI in Public Health
* Wadhwani AI Takes an Impact-First Approach to Applying Artificial Intelligence - data.org
* Winner of the H&M Foundation Global Change Award 2022
* Indian Winners of the 2019 Google AI Impact Challenge, and the first in the Asia Pacific to host Google Fellows

  




**ROLES & RESPONSIBILITY**


* Prepare survey instruments, protocols, analysis plans, and training material(s) for implementation of various research studies
* Lead, conduct and be responsible for field visits to oversee implementation of project activities (including scoping) and support for course correction
* Lead data processing, cleaning, analysis, visualization, and presentation
* Experience working with, managing, and coding on web-based data collection applications such as SurveyCTO Or KoboCollect
* Dashboard creation for said indicators and their daily maintenance to ensure the display of correct statistics to assist senior team members to take key decisions on the progress of project implementation activities
* Support lead MEL in developing the overall MEL plan, log frameworks, work plan, etc. for various projects with guidance from the program management team.
* Support lead MEL in developing research protocols and ensure approval from the required Research Ethics Committee and local IRB (as required) ensuring the protection of human subjects
* Development of reports, presentations and templates for effective internal use and dissemination of reports at state & national levels
* Function with utmost sensitivity towards data confidentiality and privacy
* Perform duties as assigned by the supervisor from time to time.

  


**QUALIFICATION**


* Master’s Degree in development studies, public health, demography, statistics, or related subjects. Masters in Epidemiology, Statistics, or Public Health is preferred
* A minimum of two years of post-qualification M&E/Quantitative research experience and demonstrated history of practical skills in monitoring and evaluation of donor-funded programs in the health or social sector
* At least two years of post qualification experience in supporting operations research protocols and conducting surveys and data collection in the health sector.
* Demonstrated experience in data management including data cleaning, standardization, maintenance, collation, analysis, and reporting
* Experience in managing web based applications for data collection, seamless display of indicators on dashboard for real time monitoring
* Experience in report writing and development of proposals for business development with a variety of domestic and international donors would be an asset.
* High proficiency and experience with statistical software for analysis of large datasets (such as SPSS, STATA, R, Python, or SAS). Knowledge of handling web-based dashboarding applications like Tableau and GIS applications is desirable.
* Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

  


**REQUIREMENTS**


* Clear understanding of monitoring and evaluation principles and practices
* Thorough theoretical knowledge in principles of dataset management and analysis and ability to apply them as per context
* Proven effectiveness while working in a team-based environment, but capable also of working independently
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively in a complex environment
* Comfort with collaborating across all levels of leadership internally and externally
* Skilled in successfully working with geographically dispersed teams and working in a multicultural environment.
* Written and oral proficiency in English, and verbal communication skills in one or more local languages
* Ability to travel as required

  


*We are committed to promoting diversity and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all our employees and encourage qualified candidates to apply irrespective of religion or belief, ethnic or social background, gender, gender identity, and disability. If you have any questions, please email us at careers@wadhwaniai.org.*

title: Senior Network Specialist
description:
We’re active members of the communities we serve. That’s why at Stantec we always design with community in mind. We believe growing a great design company happens from the inside out. We look for people who are drawn to use every talent they possess, plus creativity, determination and a drive to do the extraordinary.


The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring projects to life. Our work as architects, engineers, and consultants from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a solid history of success. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!


Primary Purpose of Job:


Contribute to the ongoing growth of Stantec ResourceNet Private India Ltd by providing technical expertise in specialist areas of pressure network modelling (potable water and recycled water). To be involved in the implementation and delivery of leading edge programmes and projects.


Support project managers/team leader by providing technical expertise to ensure that project outcomes in terms of profit, schedule, technical and quality standards, meet both the client and Stantec expectations.


Key Accountabilities:


* Hydraulic modelling


* Model build and validation


* Model calibration and optimisation


* Optioneering and outline design of hydraulic solutions


* Development impact assessment


* Preparation of technical reports / drawings


* Working with GIS databases


* Handling and managing large data sets for analysis


* Carry out other duties as may be assigned from time to time by supervisor/management,


* Need to work off-hours for client co-ordination: Occasionally


* Need to travel off-shore for training/on-site work: Occasionally


* Master’s degree in Civil/ Environmental Engineering.
* Minimum relevant experience of 8 to 15 years.
* Expert in hydraulic modelling, model calibration and model optimisation, hydraulics of pressure networks), optioneering and outline design of hydraulic solutions.
* Expert in hydraulic modelling software such InfoWorks WS, InfoWater, Bentley WaterGEMS.
* Have excellent data manipulation abilities (POWER BI, MS Excel, MS Access database type packages)
* Good skills in GIS packages, Mapinfo, ArcGIS preferred.
* Expert in technical report writing.
* Good level of client service management, i.e. able to interface with clients and to build and maintain lasting, positive relationships with our clients
* Capable to analyse, assess, evaluate the issues, complexity pertaining to projects / work packages and support the team lead in mitigating them in advance
* Has supervised and led project teams along with checking and reviewing.
* Rigorous attention to detail, able to understand and adopt workflows and commitment to personal professional development.
* Competent level of baseline skills, i.e. professional and confident with the essential, basic business and communication skills that are required for career growth in all positions.
* Flexible attitude to accepting different work assignments and pro-active attitude to execution / delivery.
* Professional chartership from recognised institutions such as ICE, CIWEM, Engineers Australia, etc. would be an advantage.

**Primary Location:** India | Pune


**Organization:** Stantec IN Business Unit


**Employee Status:** Regular


**Job Level:** Nonmanager


**Travel:** No


**Schedule:** Full time


**Job Posting:** 13/11/2023 05:11:30


**Req ID:** 1000115

description:

So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work. Redefine your personal best. Join us!


Primary Purpose of Job:


Stantec is a leader in global infrastructure, water resource development and also works in the Buildings, Mining, power & dams and Oil and Gas sectors providing engineering design and remediation, program management and technology solutions for the markets of North Americas, Europe, Middle East and Asia Pacific regions. Stantec is looking for Electrical Designer to be based in the Pune, India office who can contribute to the ongoing growth of Stantec ResourceNet Private India Ltd by providing design and drafting expertise in specialist areas of electrical systems related to power. To be involved in the implementation and delivery of leading-edge programs and projects.


Support project managers/team leader by providing technical and drafting expertise to ensure that project outcomes in terms of profit, schedule, technical and quality standards, meet both the client and Stantec expectations.


Responsibilities:


* Concept Design and detail design development for tender and or construction level of Electrical design of indoor and outdoor Substation work, WTP /WWTP / pump stations.
* Design and drafting of Single Line diagrams (SLD’s)
* Preparation of power plans
* Preparation of substation layout
* Earthing Layout- Substation Earthing, Raft Level Earthing and Equipment Earthing layout
* Preparation of Various BOQ’s and Panel Schedules
* Design and drafting / modelling of Cable tray and trenches layout
* Lighting layouts and Circuiting’s
* Cable route diagrams and conduit development
* MCC Panel GA layout
* Good understanding of the Vendor submittal drawings
* Preparation of control schematics and wiring drawings
* Good understanding of Civil / Mech / Process and other disciplines drawings
* Communicate with global internal clients for input information and project status
* Carry out other duties as may be assigned from time to time by supervisor / management.

Software Experience:


* AutoCAD
* MicroStation
* Revit
* Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel etc.), is must
* Inventor will be an advantages

Qualifications and Experience:


* Diploma/ BE in Electrical
* 4-7 years
* Knowledge of International standards like ISA, BS, IEC, NEMA, NEC, IEEE
* Good Communication skills, Presentation Skills, Learning Attitude, Good grasping power and should be a good team member.

Working experience of EHV substation and GIS substation will be added advantage

**Organization:** Stantec IN Business Unit


**Employee Status:** Regular


**Job Level:** Nonmanager


**Travel:** No


**Schedule:** Full time

title: Senior Hydrologist
description:
**Company Description**  

Statkraft is a leading company in hydropower internationally and Europe’s largest generator of renewable energy. The Group produces hydropower, wind power, solar power, gas-fired power and supplies district heating. Statkraft is a global company in energy market operations. Statkraft has 5300 employees in 21 countries.


As part of the Norwegian state owned Statkraft Group, Statkraft has been in India since 2004 and was the first foreign investor in Indian hydropower sector. The objective is to become a significant independent power producer in India over the next few years.


Our business enablers are the backbone to everything we do at Statkraft, providing seamless and value-adding work to the organisation and playing an important role in our mission towards a carbon free future. Whatever your area, you’ll provide the dedicated services and strategic support that our global and rapidly growing organisation needs to make the future greener.

**Why Statkraft?**


Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 128 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.


But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.

 **Job Description**  

As a **Senior Hydrologist** you would report to Head of Energy Management.

**Your main responsibilities:**

* You will work with Statkraft's core business and be a key contributor to the development and maintenance of our hydrological models for our hydropower portfolio in India
* Support production planning projects for hydropower assets in India
* Prepare hydrological inputs for energy market models (EMPS, SDDP) for important price areas in India,
* You will work with distributed and machine learning based hydrological modelling and prepare spatial data as model input for energy management
* You will use scripting (python) based analysis tools and post-processing algorithms for maintaining hydrological forecasting models.
* You will adapt and use Statkraft’s Hydrologic Forecasting Toolbox (SHyFT) for India. This is an internally developed open-source framework for providing distributed hydrological forecasts for hydropower production
* You will adapt on both performing and supervising discharge measurements in the field

  

**Qualifications**  

* Natural science education equivalent to Master’s Degree (from specialised institutes like TERI etc.) or an Engineering degree in Hydrology/Meteorology/Geo-sciences
* Research background in Hydrology would have additional preference.
* Familiarity with earth sciences (hydro-meteorology) modelling.
* Relevant experience of 8-10 years in academia or industry
* High proficiency in scripting with special emphasis on Python, GIS and field measurement techniques.
* Good analytical skills and knowledge of data flow.
* Good knowledge of Indian energy market
* Expertise in modelling, statistical analysis and use of geo-spatial data
* Good collaborative skills, committed, self-motivated and structured
* Good written and oral presentation ability in English
* Ability to plan ahead and work systematically and organized to deliver with high standards and quality

  

**Additional Information**  

A career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 128 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:

* Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including LinkedIn Learning and inspiring leaderships program.
* The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgrounds.
* The opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”.
* A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working

**Expected start date**: As soon as possible

**Location**: New Delhi

**Contacts**: Kishore Nukala

**Last date to submit applications**: 5th October 2023

title: Electrical Engineer
description:
Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.


We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.


As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.


The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:

 **Job Knowledge:**

* Electrical Design for Synchronous Condenser BOP.
* The successful candidate will apply a diversified knowledge of engineering principles and practices as applied to substation engineering, design, procurement, erection, testing, commissioning and operation in the electric utility industry to ensure accurate delivery that will meet utility Standards, industry standards and meet good engineering practices, policies and procedures. Hands on experience on Synchronous Condenser will be added advantage

**Job Responsibilities:*** Developing and managing design, Document Deliverables list, technical specifications, and other deliverables for AC and DC power and control systems on construction projects, Cable Schedule ,cable ways ,load schedule
* Coordinating deliverables, submissions, and system requirements with the electrical department, architects, owners, contractors, and relevant authorities
* Support power system studies (load flow, short circuit, harmonic analysis, protection coordination, arc flash analysis, grounding calculations, lighting, life safety systems and security systems)
* Undertake design of a variety of electrical design elements i.e. MV/LV Distribution with sufficient redundancy, Earthing & Bonding, Lighting systems, control & interlocks, cable management system, standby power of substation building power designs including motor controls.
* Prepare protection and control panel layouts and schematics drawings Electrical Protection Systems and SCADA System.
* Develop construction and equipment specifications, one line and three-line diagrams, panel Layouts, equipment layouts and sectional views, Layout of protective relay and metering one line / three-line diagrams, connection Diagrams, Feeder and Cable Schedules as well as prepare Bills of Materials.
* Assist the Team leader/Senior Engineer in equipment sizing and selection, presenting design solutions in meeting with clients and contractors; develop feasibility studies and technical reports
* Providing technical support for business development activities such as developing proposals and on-site field-testing and commissioning activities.
* Support arc-flash hazard calculations to determine arc-flash boundaries and required PPE
* Monitor and maintain project schedules for electrical engineering design deliverables and support projects during construction
* Analyze contractor submittals for compliance with project technical specifications and raise comments for inconsistencies, oversights and mistakes
* Identifying and clarifying technical ambiguities and conflicts in the documents with emphasis on identifying potential or probable risk during construction and installation
* Undertake liaison with System engineers, third parties and specialist system suppliers and incorporate their requirements in the detail design.
* Developing mitigation strategies for identified risks for various equipment High Voltage such as AIS /GIS switchgears, power and auxiliary transformers and various equipment in the electrical substation and connectivity with utility.
* Provide cost recommendations to the proposal team based on the bid review analysis
* Prepare, update and support the project execution engineering activities in the schedule
* Candidate should have basic knowledge on BOP Synchronous Condenser

**Required experience/Skills:**  

  

**Work experience:*** Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Systems Engineering
* 5-10 years of experience in electrical engineering with an emphasis in power substations and transmission & distribution, Synchronous Condenser
* Must have at least five (5) years of directly related industry experience designing electrical systems (i.e. power distribution, lighting, life safety systems and security systems)
* Familiar with industry and federal codes and standards (NEC, NFPA, NESC, IEEE, UFC, etc).
* High preference for candidates with extensive knowledge of software related to calculations for lighting and emergency lighting systems
* High preference for candidates with extensive experience in writing and editing electrical specification for power distribution and lighting systems
* High preference for candidates that have excellent writing and oral communication skills including report writing and presentations

**Technical skills (specific skills):*** Demonstrated experience in guiding a team of electrical engineering technologists and drafters
* Proficient with Autodesk AutoCAD and Revit software models
* Proficient with lighting modelling and power systems software.
* Demonstrated knowledge of codes, standards, construction means and methods related to electrical engineering to ensure designs are optimized for construction practices
* A basic understanding of project management basics and the ability to manage the work to meet a given budget, time and quality.
* Demonstrated ability to work with integrated teams of consultants and contractors.
* An understanding of the work produced by other disciplines in the industry including architectural, mechanical, civil, and structural consultants
* Develop detailed Bill of material for the Protection, Control and Metering devices with detailed ordering code.
* Prepare Communication and automation architectural block diagram.
* Good command of electrical computation and power system modeling software’s such as ETAP, PSCAD, Mathcad, ASPEN, PSS/E, PSS/SINCAL, Dig SILENT, SKM, CYME …etc.

**Tools/configurators:*** Be a competent user of IT tools in particular Microsoft suite and Electrical design tools such as. ETAP, Dialux, DIgSilent and other equivalent power systems modelling software.
* Working knowledge of Electronic Document Management Systems is necessary.
* Configuration experience with protective relays, IED’s, RTU’s for digitization of substations and SCADA
  


**Education Type**


B.E/B.Tech/BS-Electrical Engineering
**Job Type**


Full Time-Regular
**Experience Level**


Senior Level
**Total Years of Exp**


8 - 12

Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.


We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.


As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.


The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:

title: Specialist Operator
description:
**ARRB Systems – India**


**Job Type: Full time**


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* To efficiently and safely operate and maintain equipment on behalf of ARRB Systems India, ensuring surveys are successfully executed and in accordance with the necessary specifications of compliance.
* Calibrate the surveying equipment strictly in accordance with the specified procedures and guidelines.
* Maintain accuracy of data by ensuring equipment calibrations are done as per the recommended intervals.
* Perform mechanical / electrical maintenance on the equipment, as required.
* Provide daily feedback during projects, sharing results, obstacles with applicable stakeholders.
* Ensure equipment checklists are completed in a diligent and honest manner to contribute to troubleshooting and performance monitoring of equipment.
* Complete weekly and daily route planning for each project cycle allocation, utilising a geographic information system (GIS) to plot the most economical travel and survey route.
* Adhere to and comply with regulations, quality standards and SOP’s to ensure tasks are executed and completed in the prescribed manner.
* Ensure surveys are successfully completed and in accordance with the necessary specifications of compliance, as outlined by the Project Technical Leader.
* Adhere to good housekeeping practice by maintaining a high level of neatness and cleanliness inside and outside vehicles and the workshop, ensuring tools and equipment are utilized in a safe manner and kept in good condition.
* Identify and report risks or areas of concern to management within area of responsibility.
* Maintain effective working relationships (both internal and external), to provide the highest level of service.
* Identify and solve problems creatively whilst demonstrating a high level of integrity in line with ARRB Systems India core values.
* Work within the ARRB Systems Integrated Management System Quality, OHS and Environmental requirements and guidelines, making recommendations for improvement where necessary.


**REQUIRED SKILLS:**


* At a minimum, an Advanced Certificate in an Engineering discipline (Mechanical, Electrical or Electronic) is required, and a National Diploma in an Engineering discipline (Mechanical, Electrical or Electronic) is preferred.
* Minimum of 2 years operational experience working with electronic components (relays, fuses, wiring, fault testing etc.) and mechanical equipment (hydraulic systems, lifting equipment, etc.); fault finding and analysis.
* Basic artisan skills (soldering; basic cutting, machining, and welding; basic electrical.
* A valid driver’s license is required.
* Ability to travel for up to 2-3 weeks, or more, at a time and work weekends.
* Proficient in MS Office Suite.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including English language proficiency (read, write, and speak).
* Ability to work well within a team.
* 1-2 years’ Experience in working in a workshop is advantageous.
* Professional Registration would be advantageous.
* Ideally based in Hyderabad, India.

title: Associate Consultant
description:
We are seeking a dedicated Project Leader (PL) to join our dynamic team for Cities projects to be based in Riyadh, KSA. In this role, you will work closely with the Project Director (PD) and Project Partner (PP), contributing your expertise and leadership to shape the future of urban landscapes.



Type of contract
Permanent
Grade
Associate
Area of Expertise
Cities
Region
Middle East, India and Asia
Office / Project Location
Riyadh
Ref No
7409

**What you will be doing…**

  


* Oversee and manage urban planning projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.
* Maintain regular communication with clients, understanding their needs, addressing concerns, and providing updates on project progress.
* Lead and guide a team of planners, designers, and analysts, distributing tasks, setting objectives, and fostering a collaborative work environment.
* Develop comprehensive urban planning strategies and solutions, considering factors like zoning regulations, transportation, environmental impact, and community engagement.
* Collect, analyse, and interpret data related to demographics, land use, market trends, and infrastructure to inform planning decisions.
* Navigate through local zoning codes, regulations, and policies to ensure proposed projects align with legal requirements.
* Facilitate public meetings, workshops, and presentations to engage stakeholders and gather input for inclusive and community-oriented planning.
* Evaluate architectural and design proposals to ensure they align with the project's overall goals and urban design principles.
* Prepare detailed reports, feasibility studies, and presentations outlining project objectives, methodologies, findings, and recommendations.
* Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to address unforeseen challenges during the planning and implementation phases.
* Work closely with other professionals such as architects, engineers, economists, and environmental experts to create integrated and holistic urban plans.
* Stay updated on emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in urban planning to continuously improve project outcomes.
* Manage project budgets, including tracking expenses, optimizing resource allocation, and ensuring cost-effective project delivery.
* Contribute to business growth by identifying new project opportunities, participating in proposal writing, and nurturing client relationships.


**What do I need to be successful….**

  


* Educational background in architecture/architectural engineering, spatial and urban planning, land development, civil engineering, and/or sustainability/sustainable development.
* Significant demonstrable experience in the built environment
* Proven ability as a systems thinker, capable of operating strategically and technically within the context of the built environment.
* Demonstrated experience managing or coordinating with multiple disciplines, including infrastructure, planning, environment, GIS consultants, and other technical specialists.
* Exposure to projects spanning multiple sectors, such as hospitality, residential, retail, and cultural domains.
* Experience working on large-scale land development projects for public and private sector clients.
* Experience in city-scale urban regeneration projects, including managing urban, infrastructure, social, and economic planning aspects.
* Strong client-facing skills with a history of effectively collaborating with external sub-consultants and subject matter experts.


#LI-ID001

  


#### **A place for everyone**



Buro Happold values individual's flexible approaches to working patterns as an important part of the way you work and achieve balance. We welcome applications from those who are seeking flexibility in their careers.  

  

Our exceptional portfolio of projects is the result of the diversity of thought, identities, backgrounds and experiences that shape us. Appreciating each other’s differences is key, we want employees to feel they don’t have to mask elements of their identity to thrive.



We are working to change the lack of representation of marginalised groups in the built environment and are particularly keen to hear from anyone who feels they are underrepresented in the industry. We have much to learn from one another. Embracing difference allows us to develop the most innovative and elegant solutions.



Please let us know if there are any adjustments we could make to the application process to make it easier and more comfortable for you. Contact recruitment@burohappold.com so we can work with you to support you throughout your application.

title: Transport Planner
description:
Country/Region: IN
Field: Engineering
Location:
Bangalore (IND\\_BAN), IN
Type of Contract: Permanent
Level of experience: 05-10 years
Job number: 40633
**Around the world, SYSTRA’s specialists plan, design, integrate, test, commission, project manage and deliver mass transit and mobility solutions that are relied on by more than 50 million people every day.**


For more than 60 years, the Group has been committed to helping cities and regions contribute to their development by creating, improving and modernising their transport infrastructure with sustainability, accessibility and innovation at the heart of our designs. With over 8,250 colleagues globally and around 1000 in the UK & Ireland we are growing significantly and seeking out the very best talent to join the SYSTRA signature team and be part of leading the way in infrastructure design.


**Context**
-----------


**We are now seeking to strengthen and grow our Transport Planning team in Bangalore Office initially working as part of our Main Works of Civil on UK projects, by recruiting an experienced Transport Planners.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


**The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate a range of experience within the Civil Engineering/ Transportation/ Infrastructure sectors.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


**This is a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic Transport Planners to further their career in a highly motivated and inspirational environment.**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


**Main duties**
---------------


* **Development and calibration/validation of transport models**
--------------------------------------------------------------
* **Supporting technical report preparation for clients**
-------------------------------------------------------
* **Manage own work and continue to learn new techniques and software packages**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Assist with assessing client requirements for modelling and related tasks**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Preparing technical reports for clients**
-------------------------------------------
* **Act as technical lead on projects or modelling tasks, including overseeing inputs of junior staff**
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* **Skills transfer to junior team members**
------------------------------------------
* Transport Modelling Software (e.g. SATURN, CUBE, VISUM, EMME)
* Familiarity with UK transport modelling guidance (e.g. TAG)
* Knowledge of Economic Appraisal using TUBA, COBALT
* Data analysis (including spreadsheets and databases) and problem-solving
* Experienced in using Python, R, Visual Basic for Applications, or similar, to aid analysis and processing of data
* Knowledgeable user of data analytics and mapping tools (GIS) and able to interpret quantitative transport models
* Reporting of model results
* Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
* Experience in helping mentor more junior colleagues.
**Other degrees**
-----------------


* **Around 6 years of relevant Experience**
-----------------------------------------
* **Master’s degree level qualification or above in relevant subject (e.g., Transport Planning/Engineering or Civil Engineering)**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Why SYSTRA?**


Our three core values: Excellence, Connected Teams and Bold Leadership are kept at the heart of everything we do. We strive for the highest levels of technical excellence, achieving the best results through teamwork, both locally and internationally, and reward innovative thinking through encouraging all colleagues to think as leaders. We offer clear and well supported pathways for career development and qualification attainment, a competitive remuneration package including a bonus and private healthcare, an electric car scheme and a broad suite of flexible benefits to suit your lifestyle.


**Flexibility**  

Because we value who you are as much as what you do, we want you to feel supported at work. We offer hybrid working, balancing the benefits of working from home with time in our modern, well-equipped offices for that crucial in-person contact, team development and collaborative working. We also recognise that life doesn’t always run to the same schedule for everyone, so we have a dedicated flexible working policy to support you in tailoring your work life to reach your full potential, for more details on this, please get in touch.


**Diversity & Inclusion**


We provide a warm welcome and encourage applications from a diverse range of people who can enrich our company and offer perspectives which will drive better solutions in a truly inclusive environment. Our employee led working groups and clearly defined strategy help us to keep at the leading edge of important issues and keep us accountable. We want our colleagues to feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work and continually seek new ideas and contributions to ensure we continue to grow and develop in this space.


**Wellbeing**


It’s no surprise that people do their best work when they feel physically and mentally supported. Our SYSTRA Wellness Programme offers a wide range of support; from Wellness champions, to free health checks, healthy eating workshops and regular seminars, alongside access to a wide range of external support. We offer two paid days for charity work and an ever-growing social calendar.


Apply and find out more about how Systra can support you in your career journey. If you require any adjustments to support you in your application or interview process please email:


reasonableadjustments@systra.com where your request will be treated confidentially and with respect. We pledge to offer an interview to any candidates with a disability who apply for a role and meet the minimum criteria.


As we are always looking to expand our team, we would still be interested in hearing from you if you fulfil most, but not all, of the relevant criteria for the role – you could still be just what we are looking for.

title: Intern - Sustainable Food Systems
company: Council on Energy, Environment and Water
description:
Council on Energy, Environment and Water (CEEW), New Delhi  

Intern – Sustainable Food Systems


Terms of Reference



At CEEW, we are deliberate about what we stand for (and what we don’t stand for!) as an employer. So, if the below description strikes a chord, we would love to hear from you!


**At CEEW, we build careers in public policy**

* We offer strong visionary leadership – with emphasis on research and impact at scale
* We actively promote leadership by initiative
* We celebrate talent and ambition
* You will be surrounded by smart ambitious people who will challenge you and help you grow
* You will learn faster than your peers in other organisations
* Curiosity and irreverence, as well as responsibility, come together at CEEW
* You will get above-market remuneration
* We provide a safe space for all
* At CEEW, your life is your example for others

Designation offered:
Intern – Sustainable Food Systems
Reporting to:
Programme Lead
Location:
New Delhi, India
**Purpose**



We seek to hire a Programme Lead to conceptualise, strategise, design, lead, and expand our work in the area of sustainable food systems. With their supervisor’s support, the individual would build on The Council’s existing work in this field and develop it into a full-fledged programme. She would identify our niche and strengths and would create and maintain our thought leadership in those areas. While building and leading a team, she would advance our research, policy engagement, and impact in the fields of sustainable agriculture, food systems, forestry, ecosystem services, landscapes restoration, and biodiversity.


**Job Summary**



India stands at a complex challenge of ensuring universal nutritional security for an increasing yet largely deprived population in a rapidly changing climate. This needs action beyond producing more food – we need to evolve what we eat and how we produce, process and distribute our food.



CEEW seeks to hire a suitable candidate for an Intern position in the Sustainable Food Systems team to expand its capacity to conduct research and drive change. We are looking for a detail-oriented researcher with a hunger for impact and the ambition to make our food system sustainable.



The successful applicant will assist the team members in undertaking robust quantitative and qualitative analysis. In addition to the duties and responsibilities outlined below, the candidate should be prepared, as and when necessary, to take on additional responsibilities and respond to events and developments that cannot be anticipated easily.


**Responsibilities and Duties**


**Research**


* Independently manage allocated work-streams on quantitative and quantitative applied research on varied food system issues. Such workstreams include but are not limited to (i) identification of optimal research question(s), (ii) designing the research approach/framework (iii) if required, development and execution of primary surveys (this includes designing the questionnaires, survey monitoring, coordinating with field staffs and analysis of the survey data), (iv) if required, systematic literature reviews (v) if required, conducting stakeholder consultations, (vi) conducting the relevant analyses using appropriate qualitative and/or quantitative tools (e.g. MS Excel, STATA, etc.), and (vii) presenting the analyses in a coherent narrative in different formats.
* Travel to field sites, whenever necessary, to conduct fieldwork including focus group discussions, interviews, meetings, training or gather primary information.
* Proactively supporting team in effectively operationalizing the CEEW’s Arc of Learning.
* Regularly track policy measures taken by the government and its implementation status related to sustainable agriculture and sustainable food systems in India.
* Write high-quality research reports, publish in leading peer-reviewed journals and generate other knowledge products for the different audience such as blogs, policy briefs in regular intervals.
* Establishing and managing relationships with project counterparts from CEEW’s partners.


**Project/Programme Assistance**


* Support the senior researchers in conceptualising new projects, development of high-impact research proposals, and applications for research and general donor funding.
* Support effective outreach of research outputs through coordination with the outreach team, engagement with a broader network of stakeholders, and concerned policymakers.
* Participate in relevant conferences, workshops, training programmes for a comprehensive understanding of developments relevant to sustainable agriculture.
* Support senior team members for important meetings and sessions, prepare notes, and conduct follow-ups, as required.
* Participate in weekly team meetings and assist with preparing minutes and chairing the weekly meetings.

**Shortlisting Criteria and Key skills**


* Master's degree in agriculture/agroecology/natural resource management/impact evaluation/agricultural economics/ecological economics/complexity science/ system dynamics/food systems/nutrition/econometrics/consumer behaviour or any other relevant field relevant for food system transformation. Candidates who have developed relevant specialist skills\\* will be given a strong preference.
* Analytical skills and knowledge of mixed methods – qualitative and quantitative research methods, relevant for impact evaluation, food system analysis, political economy analysis etc.
* Project management skills to independently manage research workstreams.
* Familiarity with food and agriculture issues, policy areas and consumer trends.
* Strong communication skills for effective, efficient, and adaptive verbal and written communication, and active listening.
* Experience in dealing with stakeholders (farmers, grassroots workers, government, etc.) preferred.
* Ability to use MS Office application suite.
* Desirable: Relevant publications in peer-reviewed journals/book chapters.
* Desirable: Knowledge of GIS and remote-sensing for applications in sustainable agriculture; R/Python.


**Personality**


* Willingness to learn new (research and project management) skills.
* Ability to adapt to a new environment and deliver under tight deadlines in a professional environment.
* Striving for rigour in research and quality in work output.
* Ability to effectively work in a team while driving research with minimum assistance, when time demands independently.
* Ability to dig deeper into details, while also keeping a sense of the broader objectives and big picture.
* Willingness to learn, grow and develop at personal and professional front, at a rapid pace with a steep learning curve.
* Ability to work in an interdisciplinary and multicultural environment.


CEEW operates in a dynamic environment, and the candidate will be required to show flexibility in undertaking a variety of tasks.


**Compensation**



Competitive compensation – commensurate to the experience and matching the best of standards adopted by industry or other similar organizations for similar roles.


**Application Process**



CEEW is an equal opportunity employer, and the selection process does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, caste, ethnicity, religion, or sexuality. Female candidates are encouraged to apply.


*We review applications on a rolling basis. Interested applicants are advised to apply at the earliest possible.*


*Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your interest.*


* Example of specialist skills: Impact evaluation expertise, system mapping and system dynamics modelling, environmental and land-use modelling, life cycle assessment, consumer behaviour analysis, etc.

title: Data Specialist
description:
**Job Summary** Agronomy Data Specialist We are staffing for an international Agro informatics company, based out of Israel and USA, that develops data-driven solutions for the agriculture industry. Their data-driven solutions standardize agronomic data and provide actionable insights for agricultural professionals and growers. They have unique technology that uses agronomy data science to improve crop yield and promote sustainable agriculture. Their revolutionary approach solves the lack of data standardization and harmonization, and brings advanced AI technology to agricultural professionals worldwide. Their informatics platform brings agro professionals together and enable them to collaborate on research in order to improve agricultural practice.



We are looking for talented professionals who can support unique data provisioning for client’s products. The Job will include working with the agronomy team and development teams. The role includes in-depth agronomic research, data processing, and building new techniques to harmonize agronomic data. In this role, one will be required to restructure the agronomic database based on the client’s unique protocols and to follow with the agronomy team.



It is an excellent opportunity for those who are qualified in agricultural sciences and have ambition to pursue career in Agro data analytics and advanced AI technology working with international organizations with lot of opportunities to travel abroad.


**Responsibilities:**


* To process unstructured data into structured one by the following processes such as
	+ Data mapping process
	+ Clustering data files
	+ Follow data standardization
	+ Follow data curation processes
	+ Data restructuring
* Work with structured ontologies
* Collect agronomic data that can enrich the data set
* Contact with ag professionals worldwide to learn about their data


**Skills and Education Requirement:**


* MSc or PhD in Agricultural/environment or GIS with 1 to 5 years of experience.
* Experience in literature research
* Knowledgeable in the use of multi-index databases
* Knowledge and ability to integrate professional (scientific and public) information sources
* High-level English reading and writing skills
* Technological understanding and orientation in digital systems
* Ability to integrate agricultural knowledge from different regions of the world
* Programing skills are an advantage
* Open for international travel, if required

description:

* Complete Mission Zero Training as directed by line management

  

**Financial targets ($M)**  

* Ensure activities undertaken adhere to organisational policies and requirements associated with quality management, health and safety, legal stipulations, information security environmental policies and general


duty of care  

* Report any suspected or known OH&S incidents, hazards or risks in a timely manner in accordance with Corporate Policy.
* Develop and foster a team approach.

  

**Critical Capability Requirements**  

1. Experience with integration, operation and maintenance of survey systems (inc.LiDAR, GNSS, Inertial and Imaging devices)  

2. Understanding of electrical and data communication systems  

3. Experience in spatial data processing (e.g.LiDAR, GPS, Inertial and other)  

4. Ability to use spatial data platforms and  

analyse spatial data (Preferred)  

5. Experience in simple scripting and software development (C++, C#, PowerShell, Python, Batch) a plus  

6. Experience in working in a customer focused organisation, providing internal and external customer service  

7. Experience in setting priorities and meeting deadlines  

8. General spatial industry experience desired  

9. Experience with using Microsoft Office suite10.Well-developed interpersonal skills and demonstrated experience in working with a team.

title: GIS Specialist
description:
Job Description


* Working as GIS Specialist on multi-sectoral live projects.
* Taking care of scope related to GIS Mapping, Cadastral Mapping, GIS based tools and conversion applications, cartographic visualizations of GIS Layers and development of Property Tax Management System and other related scope of on-going and upcoming assignments.
* Writing, formatting, submitting reports to the clients.
* Writing technical approach and methodology for new bids.
* Assisting the Business Development Team in submitting GIS related EOIs, Tenders, and Proposals etc.


Location of Job: Sonipat


Salary: 2.5 – 8 Lacs/ annum


Work Experience: 3 -6 Years


Candidate Profile: Master’s Degree in Geography, Geoinformatics and related field with at least 05 year of experience of working with multidisciplinary consulting firms. Should have sound knowledge of GIS. Strong in GIS domain which includes features spatial analysis etc. Capability to capture date from multiple sources e.g. scanned images, Satellite imageries. Preferably having knowledge and experience in Cadastral Mapping, GIS based tools and conversion applications, cartographic visualizations of GIS Layers and Property Tax Management Systems. Excellent Communication Skills, Good Knowledge of MS Office, Ready to Travel, Ability to Manage multiple tasks simultaneously, Presentation Skills, Meeting Goals, Professionalism.


Keyskills


GIS Google Maps Cadastral Digitization Cartography WebGIS Pytrhon Scripting Arcobjects .net framework Property Tax Management System

title: Senior Technical Specialist
description:
**Roles and Responsibilities**


* Team management and mentoring /training of team
* Planning of manpower requirement and time estimation to meet delivery schedule
* Project progress monitoring and ensuring timely completion of project with quality
* Risk Management and mitigation
* Project management
* Understanding clients’ need and coordination with bidding and sales
* The individual will be responsible for managing the complete project cycle with an emphasis on LIDAR
* processing from planning to QC and completion
* Develop, manage and coordinate Remote sensing, GIS and UAV image processing projects
* Evaluate technological advances and promote the use of appropriate technology and applications


**Qualification, Experience & Skill Set**


* Master’s degree from a recognized university in Remote Sensing / GIS or Geoinformatics / Geospatial Technologies with minimum 10 – 15 years of experience in Remote Sensing and GIS industries
* The candidate must have a minimum of 3 – 4 years’ hands-on experience in LiDAR point cloud data processing
* Ability to plan, organize, coordinate, and prioritize multiple tasks and projects to complete job functions in an orderly and efficient manner. Also he or she needs to work under stringent deadlines
* Technical proposal writing
* Good technical skill for Remote sensing, Image Processing and GIS based analysis with exposure in Erdas and ESRI products
* Expertise in LiDAR point cloud data (mobile and aerial) processing with exposure in Terrasolid suite
* Knowledge of HD Navigation map and LOD 3
* Exposure in Photogrammetry and UAV Image Processing
* Exposure in Socket Set / LPS, DAT/EM


**Personality Traits**


* Project management skill
* Strong written and verbal communication
* Documentation and presentation skill
* Good problem solving and analytical skills
* Should be able to produce results in a fast paced environment
